name: FDW (Factory Direct Wholesale) VN-H03-White Executive Chair, for Office, Rotating, Lumbar Support, Adjustable Arms, Mesh, Ergonomic Design, 22.0 x 23.4 x 39.4 inches (56 x 59.5 x 100.5 cm)
reviews: Chair is comfortable. It‚Äôs easily tilts which makes me nervous sometimes b/c I almost feel like I‚Äôll tilt too far back & fall BUT that has NOT happened. Chair got 3 stars b/c it does not roll smoothly although it does have wheels. I have tile floors no carpet & I still feel like the chair does not roll like it should. It was cost efficient & matches perfect with my small desk so it‚Äôs still a WIN for me. I do not need to roll anyway üòÇ
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United States on 14 October 2023

name: FDW (Factory Direct Wholesale) VN-H03-White Executive Chair, for Office, Rotating, Lumbar Support, Adjustable Arms, Mesh, Ergonomic Design, 22.0 x 23.4 x 39.4 inches (56 x 59.5 x 100.5 cm)
reviews: I got this chair to replace my old one. So far its worked pretty well. I did have one issue with assembly because I put the base of the chair on backxwards (the part with the lever), so the chair would tilt forward instead of backwards, so make sure to put it on like in the picture on this product page. It was also a little difficult to screw stuff on because the holes werent very well alligned, but once I got it together, it was sturdy. Spins well, and tilts well (once I put the base on correctly).

reviews: I love this chair. It is the perfect size for my height. I am 5‚Äô0 so the chair fits me perfectly, and it is not bulky at all. If you‚Äôre looking for a chair that doesn‚Äôt take up all that space then this would be perfect. My husband is 5‚Äô8 normal built, and it was too small for him, so I would not recommend this chair for a tall heavy person because it would be too snug. It would also recommend it for a child‚Äôs/teenagers study desk too.
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United States on 18 July 2023

name: FDW (Factory Direct Wholesale) VN-H03-White Executive Chair, for Office, Rotating, Lumbar Support, Adjustable Arms, Mesh, Ergonomic Design, 22.0 x 23.4 x 39.4 inches (56 x 59.5 x 100.5 cm)
reviews: Ordered this chair for my daughter. Put together easily and works wonderful. I ordered one chair for myself, while putting it together one of the screws on the seat would not go all the way in. I returned it ordered a second one and and two screws on the bottom of the seat would not go all the way in and would fall out. I return this one too. I will be ordering a different brand.
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United States on 13 January 2024

name: FDW (Factory Direct Wholesale) VN-H03-White Executive Chair, for Office, Rotating, Lumbar Support, Adjustable Arms, Mesh, Ergonomic Design, 22.0 x 23.4 x 39.4 inches (56 x 59.5 x 100.5 cm)
reviews: I bought this chair for my wife.Pros: Simple assembly with tool included (hex key). Assembly time was 30 minutes with one cup of coffee.  Looks nice. Now here is the primary kudo, 1x fastener each and plastic cap were included as spares, something I am beginning to see more often - nice.Cons: Instructions could have been more verbose, I myself didn't need it, but I could see some people would. The plastic plugs that cover the four screws on the back of the chair continuously fall out. Simple solution, a small dab of hot glue, just small dab, so you can take them back out if ever needed.  I imagine that Elmers Glue (a small dab) would do the same trick.Overall, the price of $39.99 made it a sweet deal if it lasts for several years. The price is why I bumped it up to 5 stars. My office chair is mountain gorilla-butt strength and runs over $250.00.
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United States on 2 February 2023

reviews: If you are a human, your primary purpose is to be excellent at human relationships.If you are a chair, your primary purpose is to be excellent at supporting a human's butt - while keeping said butt and attached organic material free from pain.This chair is the best chair in almost every way: It is taller than other chairs, bigger than other chairs, stronger than other chairs, it's armrest is superior to other armrests.This chair is terrible at only one use case: Sitting.Immediately when I, a large human, sat on this chair. My butt and specifically my tail bone said, "Pressure overload, spinal injury will likely occur in 30 minutes!"I used my hand sensors to inspect the chair material and discovered it was quite lumpy. It appeared to have springs inside the chair creating an uneven distribution of pressure.I looked at my old chair and noticed that it had a low spot in the same area where this new chair was creating the most pressure.I can only conclude that the engineers who made this chair either have never sat in a chair or have no large humans nearby to test said chair and communicate that the chair is not useful for sitting purposes.Now I, as a busy human, decided to try said chair for a few days. As the days progressed, my body posture contorted to multiple sitting positions to avoid the pressure without much success. My tail bone did indeed begin to express pain.My brain concluded: "Sitting in such a chair for many hours a day would certainly lead to long term damage."Not wanting to spend additional money on another chair. I jotted a note in my brain storage for future reference: In the future, perhaps buying a chair, butt-untested, is not a great idea. Next time I will have to visit a physical-presence-selling-place-that-allows-butt-testing.Then I began my journey towards chair refactoring:After taking off the chair-back with the four support bolts - using the hex tool which came with the chair. I needed to acquire my trusted utility tool.This tool is my long-time companion which I always carry on my belt when I am wearing pants. Of course being in my home-environment without pants, I had to first travel to my clothing-storage-area to obtain my utility tool from the last-worn-pants.After removing some of the staples on the back edge of the chair, I had enough room to begin inspecting the interior of the chair's butt-support structure. I quickly found the offense:Someone had decided to place the box-springs from a small doll's bed inside the middle of my chair.I disagreed with that decision.After removing a few more staples from the cover material, I removed the box-springs entirely from the chair.At first, I thought I would modify them, but after seeing the result shape of the chair now resembled my old chair. I decided it was time for a butt-test.I was pleasantly surprised. The pressure distribution was now even and almost perfect - matching ideal butt-support specifications.tl;dr: - 5 stars after chair surgery (1 star before)
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United States on 5 August 2022

name: FDW OC-BT380-Black Office Executive Chair, Black, Ergonomic Design, Adjustable Arm, Rolling Swivel, Lumbar Support, Wide Seat, Load Capacity: 391.7 lbs (181 kg), High Back Mesh, 29.1 x 25.6 x 43.5 inches (74 x 65 x 110.5 cm)
reviews: I impulse bought this chair after my old one of 3+ years broke. It was cheap, had a high weight limit, looked strong. It is strong, very strong. It feels like it will last, it tilts back well, it feels sturdy - even the plastic arms feel sturdy. But the seat. The place your butt goes - it's awful. Within a day (I work from home, I sit a lot) my ass was hurting. I read some other reviews and I agree, there are springs or hard things in the center that are pushing up, but the pressure is killing me. I've been sitting on a pillow for 2 days, and I just ordered a memory foam seat to put on top of it - didn't help fully. My ass is sore as we speak. Unsure what to do with this, but already shopping for a new chair.
date.of.review: Reviewed in Canada on 22 February 2023

name: FDW OC-BT380-Black Office Executive Chair, Black, Ergonomic Design, Adjustable Arm, Rolling Swivel, Lumbar Support, Wide Seat, Load Capacity: 391.7 lbs (181 kg), High Back Mesh, 29.1 x 25.6 x 43.5 inches (74 x 65 x 110.5 cm)
reviews: Steel frame with comfortable extra wide padded seat.  360-degree Swivel and Lumbar support
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United States on 29 January 2024

name: FDW OC-BT380-Black Office Executive Chair, Black, Ergonomic Design, Adjustable Arm, Rolling Swivel, Lumbar Support, Wide Seat, Load Capacity: 391.7 lbs (181 kg), High Back Mesh, 29.1 x 25.6 x 43.5 inches (74 x 65 x 110.5 cm)
reviews: I bought this chair a few weeks ago for the start of online school, being a bigger fellow, I wanted something a little wider with more padding. I was pleasantly surprised by the size of the chair. Took me a little bit to put together myself, but, it wasn't too bad. My only "gripe" is that I wish my cushion was a little more padded and comfortable. It's more firm than... cushion-ey, if that makes sense. For that, I cannot give it 5 stars.
date.of.review: Reviewed in Canada on 5 January 2024

name: FDW OC-BT380-Black Office Executive Chair, Black, Ergonomic Design, Adjustable Arm, Rolling Swivel, Lumbar Support, Wide Seat, Load Capacity: 391.7 lbs (181 kg), High Back Mesh, 29.1 x 25.6 x 43.5 inches (74 x 65 x 110.5 cm)
reviews: It was taking forever to find a chair that was supportive enough with a large weight capacity for my husband. Even I needed a chair that that held more than most of this new modern comouter chairs hold. When I found this chair I was so happy. It has some great features like the lumbar support, adjustable back & arms. The one thing I wished this chair did have was that the arms folded inward and not just adjusted up and down, however being for a larger crowd I can see why they didnt add this, however even my hundbamd who is 350lbs & 6' 4" says he would like this feature. Overall it is great for the price and still works great.
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United States on 13 February 2024

name: FDW OC-BT380-Black Office Executive Chair, Black, Ergonomic Design, Adjustable Arm, Rolling Swivel, Lumbar Support, Wide Seat, Load Capacity: 391.7 lbs (181 kg), High Back Mesh, 29.1 x 25.6 x 43.5 inches (74 x 65 x 110.5 cm)
reviews: This is a nice chair.  I am not "big and tall" but wanted a wider chair so that my small dogs could sit alongside me in an office chair while I work on managing our empire.  I decided to purchase the good but used version to save a couple of dollars cause I'm cheap as heck, lol.  Chair came in a somewhat damaged box.  It was fairly easy to put together but the instructions are only picture so I wasn't 100% sure about some things, like how to put the wheels on.  The instructions didn't say anything other than showing the male wheel part going in to the female chair part so I wasn't sure they would click inside and hold in place but they did.  It's comfortable to sit in.  Downside is that the lumbar piece that slides up and down doesn't slide all the way down cause it's meant for someone taller, haha.My biggest issue with the item is that all of the screws were not in the package.  I am missing one of the screws where the back attaches on to the underneath of the chair seat and all of the arm piece screws are missing.  So I cannot attach the arms to the chair.  While I can use the chair without the arms in place, it sorta defeats the purpose of buying this chair cause I can't put the pillow in place for the dogs to lay on.  My own fault for saving a few dollars and buying a good but used chair.  Had no idea it wouldn't have all the parts to go with it.  Hoping to buy the screws locally so I can attach the arms and the last screw on the bottom.  Otherwise I'm happy with the item itself.
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United States on 3 November 2023

name: FDW OC-BT380-Black Office Executive Chair, Black, Ergonomic Design, Adjustable Arm, Rolling Swivel, Lumbar Support, Wide Seat, Load Capacity: 391.7 lbs (181 kg), High Back Mesh, 29.1 x 25.6 x 43.5 inches (74 x 65 x 110.5 cm)
reviews: Great product for the price. I am 6‚Äô2 and 300 lbs. and the chair fits me well.  It has quite a bit of room in the seat, meaning wide and long. Comfortable but makes noise as you move around in it. There was a piece on the back of the seat that broke immediately when I tried to attach it but I was still able to clip it on without bothering the look.
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United States on 26 December 2023

name: FDW OC-BT380-Black Office Executive Chair, Black, Ergonomic Design, Adjustable Arm, Rolling Swivel, Lumbar Support, Wide Seat, Load Capacity: 391.7 lbs (181 kg), High Back Mesh, 29.1 x 25.6 x 43.5 inches (74 x 65 x 110.5 cm)
reviews: Honestly bought this as a hold over until I can afford a high end ergonomic chair...  With that said I'm really in no rush to replace this.  I'm 6'4, almost 300lb, the chair feels great.  The assembly was slightly annoying (I just wish the base was preassembled and welded instead of the machine screws- still very sturdy!).  The mesh back is change for me and feels great in long gaming or work sessions, the seat cushion is very respectable for the moneyPros:+Feels sturdy from the moment I sat on it+Solid metal/steel support components+Price to value (to me)+The "3d armrests" adjust vertically easy but don't rotate like my old chair... Which I prefer!!!!  The can be adjusted narrow or weirder with an allen wrench/key (came with a solid one and a nice handle to make building easier)+Decent instructions+Decent lumbar adjustmentCons:-Assembley can be cumbersome, might need an extra pair of hands to hold things in place to assemble, although if you're patient take your time you can do it alone.-each spoke on the base is attached with two fairly heavy duty machine screws, does feel good, but personally just wish this was preassembled and welded.-if you're significantly taller than me, say 6'6 and above the back my might be a bit low.  For me I prefer this for acoustic reasons (I'm an audiophile and don't want my head in reflection zone like most gamer chairs do). But if you want a head/neck rest maybe reconsider.
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United States on 8 July 2023

name: FDW OC-BT380-Black Office Executive Chair, Black, Ergonomic Design, Adjustable Arm, Rolling Swivel, Lumbar Support, Wide Seat, Load Capacity: 391.7 lbs (181 kg), High Back Mesh, 29.1 x 25.6 x 43.5 inches (74 x 65 x 110.5 cm)
reviews: Prend un peu de temps a monter mais ces ok la chaise est tres large parfait pour les personne qui sont enrobe comme moi.Il a de la place pour bouge tu n`est pas serre dedans.Le siege est en tissus alors il va falloir que j ajoute un protecteur pour etre certaine qu`elle reste propre.Pour le confort un peu dure mais ces normal ca va prendre un peu de temps car elle est neuve..et pour le reste l avenir nous le dira mais pour tout suite je la recommande fortement et surtout pour le prix vous ne pourrez pas trouver mieux ailleur.Merci
date.of.review: Reviewed in Canada on 5 January 2024

name: FDW OC-BT380-Black Office Executive Chair, Black, Ergonomic Design, Adjustable Arm, Rolling Swivel, Lumbar Support, Wide Seat, Load Capacity: 391.7 lbs (181 kg), High Back Mesh, 29.1 x 25.6 x 43.5 inches (74 x 65 x 110.5 cm)
reviewer: Love the chair, it was easy to assemble. Stability is great
reviews: Very comfortable and my husband fits well in it (he‚Äôs a big guy lol)
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United States on 3 February 2024

name: FDW OC-BT380-Black Office Executive Chair, Black, Ergonomic Design, Adjustable Arm, Rolling Swivel, Lumbar Support, Wide Seat, Load Capacity: 391.7 lbs (181 kg), High Back Mesh, 29.1 x 25.6 x 43.5 inches (74 x 65 x 110.5 cm)
reviews: Bought this for my home office. It's easy to assemble. The wheels work well on my carpet. It's sturdy enough, overall. It's big! It's probably larger than what I needed, or realized when I bought it. But it works! I have lower back disc issues and a bruised tail bone. I use a special butt-pillow while sitting on this (and any) chair. So far I haven't had any pain arise while using this chair. The back rest is mesh and very firm. I guess that's good considering the weight it's supposed to support. The lumbar piece is really firm, too, which I dislike, but then again, my back hasn't had any problems with it as it does with other office chairs, so maybe this firmness is what my back needs. The seat cushion of the chair is cushy and I could see it being uncomfortable and flattened after prolonged use, so I'd recommend buying an additional cushion if you're like me and have back/butt issues. The arms are adjustable up/down. Since the seat is extra wide, the arms aren't squishing into my sides. The back doesn't recline independently from the chair (a feature my in-office chair has) but rather the whole seat tilts back slightly (not very far). Overall, good chair.
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United States on 2 June 2023

name: FDW OC-BT380-Black Office Executive Chair, Black, Ergonomic Design, Adjustable Arm, Rolling Swivel, Lumbar Support, Wide Seat, Load Capacity: 391.7 lbs (181 kg), High Back Mesh, 29.1 x 25.6 x 43.5 inches (74 x 65 x 110.5 cm)
reviews: well i ordered a big boy chair, and man oh man i got one :) when i first saw the seat, i reverted to an episode of the simpsons.... "i'm looking for mr. gass, mr hugh gass." lol. the chair rocks. i got it because i was getting sick of chairs that collapse down on me after a few months. this chair is comfortable to me at its lowest setting, so as far as i am concerned i think i have the final chair i will have to buy. but it has been only 2 months now, so time will be the real judge of that one.
date.of.review: Reviewed in Canada on 12 September 2023

name: FDW OC-BT380-Black Office Executive Chair, Black, Ergonomic Design, Adjustable Arm, Rolling Swivel, Lumbar Support, Wide Seat, Load Capacity: 391.7 lbs (181 kg), High Back Mesh, 29.1 x 25.6 x 43.5 inches (74 x 65 x 110.5 cm)
reviews: Firstly, the chair does what it says. I've loved it and it's served me well. I'm 6'0 and pushing 400 so it definitely held up its end...for a year.  Within 9 months the back plastic piece along the middle broke and wouldn't stay on.  It's no doubt associated with the weight being pushed onto the ergonomic piece and back into the plastic.  I wasn't upset at that, it's simply an aesthetic piece which served no real purpose.The part I'm mad about though is the seat plate. Around 6 months in the lever to keep it from leaning started to slip and I'd jolt backwards, not the end of the world, I just stopped leaning back as much and checked the lever more frequently.  However, after a slip I noticed the chair had a slight lean to the left where the lever sticks into. I examined it and noticed that some parts had broke and small metal bits were cracked. it's progressively gotten worse and now after a year, I cannot use the chair as it's lean is constant and unsustainable for my back.I wish products advertised as size friendly would also have the same durability as those meant for smaller folk.
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United States on 12 October 2023

name: FDW OC-BT380-Black Office Executive Chair, Black, Ergonomic Design, Adjustable Arm, Rolling Swivel, Lumbar Support, Wide Seat, Load Capacity: 391.7 lbs (181 kg), High Back Mesh, 29.1 x 25.6 x 43.5 inches (74 x 65 x 110.5 cm)
reviews: I got this chair about 6 months ago when I got a job working full time from home - so I have spent 8-9 hours a day in this chair for the last 6 months. I am 5 foot 5 and weigh over 350 pounds. I am also very hippy - I carry that weight in my butt and thighs. This chair is wide enough to accommodate  my massive backside.When I was putting it together a small piece of plastic that was part of the back broke, so the back did not come together as tightly as it should. Picture 2 shows the gap - but I could not tell that it caused any functional issues so I let it be.With my weight and the casters that were provided, I was hurting my knees getting the chair to move - so I replaced the casters that came with the chair with the rollerblade type casters - that solved that problem. I also added arm cushions to the arm rests. I like the adjustability of the arm rests - they seem to stay put wherever you put them so you can get the height to meet your needs.I have had no problem keeping the chair at the right height - although I now have it at the lowest position because this is most comfortable for my legs.The lumbar support pillow behind the back slides up and down, but does not stay where I put it and ends up down at the bottom by the end of the day. Since I do have a big backside I need the lumbar to be higher.My big issue is that I seem to have worn down any support that existed in the seat cushion. By the end of the day my butt just hurts. I have tried adding a cushion, but that makes the chair too tall for me to easily get in to it. (One of the unspoken issues with being large and trying to sit in a chair with wheels is that you can easily shoot the chair across the room and end up on the floor if you can't sit down into it with enough of your behind in the chair.)I think this chair would be perfectly fine if I was only using it a few hours a day. In fact, I'm good in it for about 4-5 hours a day. It just does not work for me for all day and I have ordered a more expensive chair.
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United States on 10 August 2022

name: FDW OC-BT380-Black Office Executive Chair, Black, Ergonomic Design, Adjustable Arm, Rolling Swivel, Lumbar Support, Wide Seat, Load Capacity: 391.7 lbs (181 kg), High Back Mesh, 29.1 x 25.6 x 43.5 inches (74 x 65 x 110.5 cm)
reviews: Ordered three chairs, the assembly was easy with the exception of a piece missing for one of the chairs. Called the number listed and they said the part will be sent out in 7-10 days. Chairs are comfortable and fit our needs.
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United States on 5 November 2023

name: FDW OC-BT380-Black Office Executive Chair, Black, Ergonomic Design, Adjustable Arm, Rolling Swivel, Lumbar Support, Wide Seat, Load Capacity: 391.7 lbs (181 kg), High Back Mesh, 29.1 x 25.6 x 43.5 inches (74 x 65 x 110.5 cm)
reviews: I know this is supposed to be big and tall but you should know that the seat on this is MUCH larger than your average chair.  The seat is very deep - to the point where I have to shuffle my bottom back on it just to get the back support and it leaves my legs uncomfortable.  If you are shorter you will not like this chair.  It's mostly comfortable but the seat doesnt have much cushion.
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United States on 19 January 2024

name: FDW OC-BT380-Black Office Executive Chair, Black, Ergonomic Design, Adjustable Arm, Rolling Swivel, Lumbar Support, Wide Seat, Load Capacity: 391.7 lbs (181 kg), High Back Mesh, 29.1 x 25.6 x 43.5 inches (74 x 65 x 110.5 cm)
reviews: I like that there is a decent amount of padding on the chair cushion that it is comfortable for all computer activities and features a nice wide seat you can relax in for heavy people with chronic body pain: though I haven't been able to untense the knob to allow that recline they speak of in the ad.
date.of.review: Reviewed in Canada on 1 October 2023

name: FDW OC-BT380-Black Office Executive Chair, Black, Ergonomic Design, Adjustable Arm, Rolling Swivel, Lumbar Support, Wide Seat, Load Capacity: 391.7 lbs (181 kg), High Back Mesh, 29.1 x 25.6 x 43.5 inches (74 x 65 x 110.5 cm)
reviews: I would recommend this to anyone that is needing an office chair, I love the wide seat and that the lumbar support can be adjusted and that it stays in place...this chair is highly recommended

name: FDW OC-BT380-Black Office Executive Chair, Black, Ergonomic Design, Adjustable Arm, Rolling Swivel, Lumbar Support, Wide Seat, Load Capacity: 391.7 lbs (181 kg), High Back Mesh, 29.1 x 25.6 x 43.5 inches (74 x 65 x 110.5 cm)
reviewer: Love the chair, it was easy to assemble. Stability is great

date.of.review: Reviewed in the United States on 3 February 2024

name: FDW OC-BT380-Black Office Executive Chair, Black, Ergonomic Design, Adjustable Arm, Rolling Swivel, Lumbar Support, Wide Seat, Load Capacity: 391.7 lbs (181 kg), High Back Mesh, 29.1 x 25.6 x 43.5 inches (74 x 65 x 110.5 cm)
reviews: Bought this for my home office. It's easy to assemble. The wheels work well on my carpet. It's sturdy enough, overall. It's big! It's probably larger than what I needed, or realized when I bought it. But it works! I have lower back disc issues and a bruised tail bone. I use a special butt-pillow while sitting on this (and any) chair. So far I haven't had any pain arise while using this chair. The back rest is mesh and very firm. I guess that's good considering the weight it's supposed to support. The lumbar piece is really firm, too, which I dislike, but then again, my back hasn't had any problems with it as it does with other office chairs, so maybe this firmness is what my back needs. The seat cushion of the chair is cushy and I could see it being uncomfortable and flattened after prolonged use, so I'd recommend buying an additional cushion if you're like me and have back/butt issues. The arms are adjustable up/down. Since the seat is extra wide, the arms aren't squishing into my sides. The back doesn't recline independently from the chair (a feature my in-office chair has) but rather the whole seat tilts back slightly (not very far). Overall, good chair.
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United States on 2 June 2023

name: FDW OC-BT380-Black Office Executive Chair, Black, Ergonomic Design, Adjustable Arm, Rolling Swivel, Lumbar Support, Wide Seat, Load Capacity: 391.7 lbs (181 kg), High Back Mesh, 29.1 x 25.6 x 43.5 inches (74 x 65 x 110.5 cm)
reviews: well i ordered a big boy chair, and man oh man i got one :) when i first saw the seat, i reverted to an episode of the simpsons.... "i'm looking for mr. gass, mr hugh gass." lol. the chair rocks. i got it because i was getting sick of chairs that collapse down on me after a few months. this chair is comfortable to me at its lowest setting, so as far as i am concerned i think i have the final chair i will have to buy. but it has been only 2 months now, so time will be the real judge of that one.
date.of.review: Reviewed in Canada on 12 September 2023

name: FDW OC-BT380-Black Office Executive Chair, Black, Ergonomic Design, Adjustable Arm, Rolling Swivel, Lumbar Support, Wide Seat, Load Capacity: 391.7 lbs (181 kg), High Back Mesh, 29.1 x 25.6 x 43.5 inches (74 x 65 x 110.5 cm)
reviews: Firstly, the chair does what it says. I've loved it and it's served me well. I'm 6'0 and pushing 400 so it definitely held up its end...for a year.  Within 9 months the back plastic piece along the middle broke and wouldn't stay on.  It's no doubt associated with the weight being pushed onto the ergonomic piece and back into the plastic.  I wasn't upset at that, it's simply an aesthetic piece which served no real purpose.The part I'm mad about though is the seat plate. Around 6 months in the lever to keep it from leaning started to slip and I'd jolt backwards, not the end of the world, I just stopped leaning back as much and checked the lever more frequently.  However, after a slip I noticed the chair had a slight lean to the left where the lever sticks into. I examined it and noticed that some parts had broke and small metal bits were cracked. it's progressively gotten worse and now after a year, I cannot use the chair as it's lean is constant and unsustainable for my back.I wish products advertised as size friendly would also have the same durability as those meant for smaller folk.
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United States on 12 October 2023

name: FDW OC-BT380-Black Office Executive Chair, Black, Ergonomic Design, Adjustable Arm, Rolling Swivel, Lumbar Support, Wide Seat, Load Capacity: 391.7 lbs (181 kg), High Back Mesh, 29.1 x 25.6 x 43.5 inches (74 x 65 x 110.5 cm)
reviews: I got this chair about 6 months ago when I got a job working full time from home - so I have spent 8-9 hours a day in this chair for the last 6 months. I am 5 foot 5 and weigh over 350 pounds. I am also very hippy - I carry that weight in my butt and thighs. This chair is wide enough to accommodate  my massive backside.When I was putting it together a small piece of plastic that was part of the back broke, so the back did not come together as tightly as it should. Picture 2 shows the gap - but I could not tell that it caused any functional issues so I let it be.With my weight and the casters that were provided, I was hurting my knees getting the chair to move - so I replaced the casters that came with the chair with the rollerblade type casters - that solved that problem. I also added arm cushions to the arm rests. I like the adjustability of the arm rests - they seem to stay put wherever you put them so you can get the height to meet your needs.I have had no problem keeping the chair at the right height - although I now have it at the lowest position because this is most comfortable for my legs.The lumbar support pillow behind the back slides up and down, but does not stay where I put it and ends up down at the bottom by the end of the day. Since I do have a big backside I need the lumbar to be higher.My big issue is that I seem to have worn down any support that existed in the seat cushion. By the end of the day my butt just hurts. I have tried adding a cushion, but that makes the chair too tall for me to easily get in to it. (One of the unspoken issues with being large and trying to sit in a chair with wheels is that you can easily shoot the chair across the room and end up on the floor if you can't sit down into it with enough of your behind in the chair.)I think this chair would be perfectly fine if I was only using it a few hours a day. In fact, I'm good in it for about 4-5 hours a day. It just does not work for me for all day and I have ordered a more expensive chair.
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United States on 10 August 2022

name: FDW OC-BT380-Black Office Executive Chair, Black, Ergonomic Design, Adjustable Arm, Rolling Swivel, Lumbar Support, Wide Seat, Load Capacity: 391.7 lbs (181 kg), High Back Mesh, 29.1 x 25.6 x 43.5 inches (74 x 65 x 110.5 cm)
reviews: Ordered three chairs, the assembly was easy with the exception of a piece missing for one of the chairs. Called the number listed and they said the part will be sent out in 7-10 days. Chairs are comfortable and fit our needs.
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United States on 5 November 2023

name: FDW OC-BT380-Black Office Executive Chair, Black, Ergonomic Design, Adjustable Arm, Rolling Swivel, Lumbar Support, Wide Seat, Load Capacity: 391.7 lbs (181 kg), High Back Mesh, 29.1 x 25.6 x 43.5 inches (74 x 65 x 110.5 cm)
reviews: I know this is supposed to be big and tall but you should know that the seat on this is MUCH larger than your average chair.  The seat is very deep - to the point where I have to shuffle my bottom back on it just to get the back support and it leaves my legs uncomfortable.  If you are shorter you will not like this chair.  It's mostly comfortable but the seat doesnt have much cushion.
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United States on 19 January 2024

name: FDW OC-BT380-Black Office Executive Chair, Black, Ergonomic Design, Adjustable Arm, Rolling Swivel, Lumbar Support, Wide Seat, Load Capacity: 391.7 lbs (181 kg), High Back Mesh, 29.1 x 25.6 x 43.5 inches (74 x 65 x 110.5 cm)
reviews: I like that there is a decent amount of padding on the chair cushion that it is comfortable for all computer activities and features a nice wide seat you can relax in for heavy people with chronic body pain: though I haven't been able to untense the knob to allow that recline they speak of in the ad.
date.of.review: Reviewed in Canada on 1 October 2023

name: FDW OC-BT380-Black Office Executive Chair, Black, Ergonomic Design, Adjustable Arm, Rolling Swivel, Lumbar Support, Wide Seat, Load Capacity: 391.7 lbs (181 kg), High Back Mesh, 29.1 x 25.6 x 43.5 inches (74 x 65 x 110.5 cm)
reviews: I would recommend this to anyone that is needing an office chair, I love the wide seat and that the lumbar support can be adjusted and that it stays in place...this chair is highly recommended
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United States on 8 January 2024

name: FDW OC-BT380-Black Office Executive Chair, Black, Ergonomic Design, Adjustable Arm, Rolling Swivel, Lumbar Support, Wide Seat, Load Capacity: 391.7 lbs (181 kg), High Back Mesh, 29.1 x 25.6 x 43.5 inches (74 x 65 x 110.5 cm)

reviews: Very comfortable and my husband fits well in it (he‚Äôs a big guy lol)
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United States on 3 February 2024

name: FDW OC-BT380-Black Office Executive Chair, Black, Ergonomic Design, Adjustable Arm, Rolling Swivel, Lumbar Support, Wide Seat, Load Capacity: 391.7 lbs (181 kg), High Back Mesh, 29.1 x 25.6 x 43.5 inches (74 x 65 x 110.5 cm)
reviews: Bought this for my home office. It's easy to assemble. The wheels work well on my carpet. It's sturdy enough, overall. It's big! It's probably larger than what I needed, or realized when I bought it. But it works! I have lower back disc issues and a bruised tail bone. I use a special butt-pillow while sitting on this (and any) chair. So far I haven't had any pain arise while using this chair. The back rest is mesh and very firm. I guess that's good considering the weight it's supposed to support. The lumbar piece is really firm, too, which I dislike, but then again, my back hasn't had any problems with it as it does with other office chairs, so maybe this firmness is what my back needs. The seat cushion of the chair is cushy and I could see it being uncomfortable and flattened after prolonged use, so I'd recommend buying an additional cushion if you're like me and have back/butt issues. The arms are adjustable up/down. Since the seat is extra wide, the arms aren't squishing into my sides. The back doesn't recline independently from the chair (a feature my in-office chair has) but rather the whole seat tilts back slightly (not very far). Overall, good chair.
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United States on 2 June 2023

name: FDW OC-BT380-Black Office Executive Chair, Black, Ergonomic Design, Adjustable Arm, Rolling Swivel, Lumbar Support, Wide Seat, Load Capacity: 391.7 lbs (181 kg), High Back Mesh, 29.1 x 25.6 x 43.5 inches (74 x 65 x 110.5 cm)
reviews: well i ordered a big boy chair, and man oh man i got one :) when i first saw the seat, i reverted to an episode of the simpsons.... "i'm looking for mr. gass, mr hugh gass." lol. the chair rocks. i got it because i was getting sick of chairs that collapse down on me after a few months. this chair is comfortable to me at its lowest setting, so as far as i am concerned i think i have the final chair i will have to buy. but it has been only 2 months now, so time will be the real judge of that one.
date.of.review: Reviewed in Canada on 12 September 2023

name: FDW OC-BT380-Black Office Executive Chair, Black, Ergonomic Design, Adjustable Arm, Rolling Swivel, Lumbar Support, Wide Seat, Load Capacity: 391.7 lbs (181 kg), High Back Mesh, 29.1 x 25.6 x 43.5 inches (74 x 65 x 110.5 cm)
reviews: Firstly, the chair does what it says. I've loved it and it's served me well. I'm 6'0 and pushing 400 so it definitely held up its end...for a year.  Within 9 months the back plastic piece along the middle broke and wouldn't stay on.  It's no doubt associated with the weight being pushed onto the ergonomic piece and back into the plastic.  I wasn't upset at that, it's simply an aesthetic piece which served no real purpose.The part I'm mad about though is the seat plate. Around 6 months in the lever to keep it from leaning started to slip and I'd jolt backwards, not the end of the world, I just stopped leaning back as much and checked the lever more frequently.  However, after a slip I noticed the chair had a slight lean to the left where the lever sticks into. I examined it and noticed that some parts had broke and small metal bits were cracked. it's progressively gotten worse and now after a year, I cannot use the chair as it's lean is constant and unsustainable for my back.I wish products advertised as size friendly would also have the same durability as those meant for smaller folk.
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United States on 12 October 2023

name: FDW OC-BT380-Black Office Executive Chair, Black, Ergonomic Design, Adjustable Arm, Rolling Swivel, Lumbar Support, Wide Seat, Load Capacity: 391.7 lbs (181 kg), High Back Mesh, 29.1 x 25.6 x 43.5 inches (74 x 65 x 110.5 cm)
reviews: I got this chair about 6 months ago when I got a job working full time from home - so I have spent 8-9 hours a day in this chair for the last 6 months. I am 5 foot 5 and weigh over 350 pounds. I am also very hippy - I carry that weight in my butt and thighs. This chair is wide enough to accommodate  my massive backside.When I was putting it together a small piece of plastic that was part of the back broke, so the back did not come together as tightly as it should. Picture 2 shows the gap - but I could not tell that it caused any functional issues so I let it be.With my weight and the casters that were provided, I was hurting my knees getting the chair to move - so I replaced the casters that came with the chair with the rollerblade type casters - that solved that problem. I also added arm cushions to the arm rests. I like the adjustability of the arm rests - they seem to stay put wherever you put them so you can get the height to meet your needs.I have had no problem keeping the chair at the right height - although I now have it at the lowest position because this is most comfortable for my legs.The lumbar support pillow behind the back slides up and down, but does not stay where I put it and ends up down at the bottom by the end of the day. Since I do have a big backside I need the lumbar to be higher.My big issue is that I seem to have worn down any support that existed in the seat cushion. By the end of the day my butt just hurts. I have tried adding a cushion, but that makes the chair too tall for me to easily get in to it. (One of the unspoken issues with being large and trying to sit in a chair with wheels is that you can easily shoot the chair across the room and end up on the floor if you can't sit down into it with enough of your behind in the chair.)I think this chair would be perfectly fine if I was only using it a few hours a day. In fact, I'm good in it for about 4-5 hours a day. It just does not work for me for all day and I have ordered a more expensive chair.
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United States on 10 August 2022

name: FDW OC-BT380-Black Office Executive Chair, Black, Ergonomic Design, Adjustable Arm, Rolling Swivel, Lumbar Support, Wide Seat, Load Capacity: 391.7 lbs (181 kg), High Back Mesh, 29.1 x 25.6 x 43.5 inches (74 x 65 x 110.5 cm)
reviews: Ordered three chairs, the assembly was easy with the exception of a piece missing for one of the chairs. Called the number listed and they said the part will be sent out in 7-10 days. Chairs are comfortable and fit our needs.
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United States on 5 November 2023

name: FDW OC-BT380-Black Office Executive Chair, Black, Ergonomic Design, Adjustable Arm, Rolling Swivel, Lumbar Support, Wide Seat, Load Capacity: 391.7 lbs (181 kg), High Back Mesh, 29.1 x 25.6 x 43.5 inches (74 x 65 x 110.5 cm)
reviews: I know this is supposed to be big and tall but you should know that the seat on this is MUCH larger than your average chair.  The seat is very deep - to the point where I have to shuffle my bottom back on it just to get the back support and it leaves my legs uncomfortable.  If you are shorter you will not like this chair.  It's mostly comfortable but the seat doesnt have much cushion.
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United States on 19 January 2024

name: FDW OC-BT380-Black Office Executive Chair, Black, Ergonomic Design, Adjustable Arm, Rolling Swivel, Lumbar Support, Wide Seat, Load Capacity: 391.7 lbs (181 kg), High Back Mesh, 29.1 x 25.6 x 43.5 inches (74 x 65 x 110.5 cm)
reviews: I like that there is a decent amount of padding on the chair cushion that it is comfortable for all computer activities and features a nice wide seat you can relax in for heavy people with chronic body pain: though I haven't been able to untense the knob to allow that recline they speak of in the ad.
date.of.review: Reviewed in Canada on 1 October 2023

name: FDW OC-BT380-Black Office Executive Chair, Black, Ergonomic Design, Adjustable Arm, Rolling Swivel, Lumbar Support, Wide Seat, Load Capacity: 391.7 lbs (181 kg), High Back Mesh, 29.1 x 25.6 x 43.5 inches (74 x 65 x 110.5 cm)
reviews: I would recommend this to anyone that is needing an office chair, I love the wide seat and that the lumbar support can be adjusted and that it stays in place...this chair is highly recommended
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United States on 8 January 2024

name: Flash Furniture X20 Gaming Chair Racing Office Ergonomic Computer PC Adjustable Swivel Chair with Fully Reclining Back in Red LeatherSoft
reviews: Es la primera vez que hago una rese√±a en amazon. He tenido la necesidad de, despu√©s de montar y probar la silla por un par de horas, venir corriendo para deciros que NO LA COMPREIS! Pido perd√≥n adelantado por si me sale alguna palabrota, pues estoy muy, muy, muy cabreado con la porquer√≠a que me ha llegado.Es, sinceramente, la peor silla que he tenido en toda mi vida. Os juro que no exagero. Suelo pasarme entre 4 y 8 horas delante del ordenador al d√≠a, y siempre he tenido sillas de oficina normales. Por una vez pens√© que una silla de estas "gaming" podr√≠a dar el pego con mi nuevo setup y decid√≠ lanzarme. Cagada total.Inc√≥moda: los cojines son muy delgados y demasiado blandos, y el respaldo queda muy alejado de los reposabrazos, que solo son regulables en altura. El tejido me ha parecido demasiado caliente, de los que te hacen sudar de valiente, y mira que estamos en pleno invierno (estoy a 16¬∫ en mi oficina). No me quiero imaginar como ser√≠a esta porquer√≠a en verano.Mal√≠sima calidad: la tela es de lo peor que he visto nunca en una silla. Incluso una silla de oficina de 60-80‚Ç¨ tiene mejores telas. Solo de abrir el paquete, han saltado 4 grapas de debajo el asiento y ya hay un trozo de tela suelto en una esquina inferior. Las ruedas son de pl√°stico barato, al igual que la base.Montaje: tedioso. Ni te plantees montarla con las herramientas que trae. Te vas a desesperar. En muchos agujeros, los tornillos se encallan por los trozos de tela que se meten en la rosca. Hay alg√∫n par de agujeros que no encajan y tienes que forzar un poco.Sinceramente quer√≠a echar unas fotos y colgarlas, pero es que no pienso perder m√°s tiempo en esto, que entre el montaje y escribir esta rese√±a ya llevo 2 horas. Ahora solo pensar que tengo que desmontarlo todo para que se la puedan llevar de vuelta me da dolor de cabeza.Lo que m√°s rabia me da es que es una silla de unos 230‚Ç¨. Con 230‚Ç¨ cualquier persona se puede pensar que es una silla tirando m√°s a premium que a b√°sica, pero no. Sinceramente me siento muy estafado. Hasta he enviado un correo a los fabricantes cag√°ndome en ellos y para pedirles que paren de estafar a la gente.Es m√°s, compr√© esta silla reacondicionada, sin los cojines (de los que no puedo opinar, aunque los he sustituido por unos parecidos de una silla de un colega para poder decidir si compraba unos a parte o no) por 90‚Ç¨ y a√∫n me siento muy estafado. He tenido sillas de 50‚Ç¨ que le dan diez mil vueltas a esta porquer√≠a, en comodidad y en calidad. Sinceramente, que Amazon tenga listado este producto me parece un insulto y una falta de respecto para sus clientes. No la querr√≠a ni gratis, y no va nada en broma.Espero que mi rese√±a le parezca √∫til a alguien, y que no se deje enga√±ar por posibles rese√±as compradas, que √∫ltimamente Amazon est√° lleno.

name: Vnewone Ergonomic Office Chair Desk Computer Mesh Executive Task Rolling Gaming Swivel Modern Adjustable with Mid Back Lumbar Support Armrest for Home Women Men, Black
reviews: You get what you pay for - Low QualitySide handle came off and the bolt/screw does not hold it in place after 3 months of mild useafter a year the chair is in really bad shape, it comes down by itself after seating on it for 10 minutes, back ripped, the cushion is smashed (I am ~190lbs)I wouldn't recommend it if you are looking for something high quality or at least something that would last couple years
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United States on 14 March 2023

name: Vnewone Ergonomic Office Chair Desk Computer Mesh Executive Task Rolling Gaming Swivel Modern Adjustable with Mid Back Lumbar Support Armrest for Home Women Men, Black
reviews: If you are in a chair that isn't on wheels and you need an inexpensive upgradethis chair will do in a pinch,  however  eventually  you will grow accustom to the reality that if you are going to spendconsiderable time in this chair you will need better back support or just be okay with no back support.At first it was great because I was using just an ordinary chair  however eventually  if you are like meyou will crave  and wish you had bought something with more back  and neck support.As to neck the chair only  reaches just under the shoulders so you will have no neck coverage.Good chair for someone you kinda despiseAffordable  and for the most part it was easy to put together once you figure it out  with only minimalissues with things not aligning up as perfectly as they should and some  tinkering and adjusting was requiredto assemble.Arm rests are okay.Perhaps the company should offer an additional or  available to purchase back cushion for when someone needs a little more back support.
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United States on 18 March 2021

name: Vnewone Ergonomic Office Chair Desk Computer Mesh Executive Task Rolling Gaming Swivel Modern Adjustable with Mid Back Lumbar Support Armrest for Home Women Men, Black
reviews: I've been using this chair a couple of days. Assembly wasn't difficult and the directions were okay. You get what you pay for and that said, this chair is not bad. There isn't much padding in the seat and you start to feel that in a hurry, so I put a 3" thick memory foam pillow on the seat and it's more comfortable. If I'm going to compare it to the chairs I've had in my office, it's definitely going to fall short, but for this price I'll give it 4 stars. It don't find it too small, but I'm not very big. I think it will last a while for me.
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United States on 6 January 2021

name: Vnewone Ergonomic Office Chair Desk Computer Mesh Executive Task Rolling Gaming Swivel Modern Adjustable with Mid Back Lumbar Support Armrest for Home Women Men, Black
reviews: first, u need manforce to assemble this, OTHERWISE you will complain as some reviews above that the armbar doesn't staysecond, this chair is designed for Ergonomic purpose,  so sit all the way back to the seatback, OTHERWISE you will complain it is tilting forwardthird, not for big guy(>220lb or 6'5), or petite but fat ass women . the width of seat  just fits for normal ppl(6ft 180lb)last, the armbar is just for the typing arm, not for big boss laying back, big bosses are rich should get expensive relax deluxe chair
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United States on 1 January 2021

name: Vnewone Ergonomic Office Chair Desk Computer Mesh Executive Task Rolling Gaming Swivel Modern Adjustable with Mid Back Lumbar Support Armrest for Home Women Men, Black
reviews: Good item,  use it every day
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United States on 25 June 2023

name: Vnewone Ergonomic Office Chair Desk Computer Mesh Executive Task Rolling Gaming Swivel Modern Adjustable with Mid Back Lumbar Support Armrest for Home Women Men, Black
reviews: Building was easy and fast. Which was what worried me. But if you follow the instructions it‚Äôs pretty easy. I just don‚Äôt feel it‚Äôs the most comfortable chair. Specially when you have to sit for a full day of work. The back gives you this weird angle that makes you feel uncomfortable sitting so straight and the cushion isn‚Äôt as soft after a few hours of sitting. This was one of those purchases I regret. Should of paid more for a well cushioned chair that doesn‚Äôt kill my back more. This one is not worth it unless you will not be sitting long hours on it. It has a cute design I‚Äôll give it that
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United States on 4 November 2021

name: Vnewone Ergonomic Office Chair Desk Computer Mesh Executive Task Rolling Gaming Swivel Modern Adjustable with Mid Back Lumbar Support Armrest for Home Women Men, Black
reviews: Working from home now - since last March due to the COVID Pandemic.  Because of standing and working at my laptop and poor posture, I was experiencing severe neck pain.I reviewed a lot of chairs and decided to try this one even though it was much more inexpensive than most of the others. I am glad I did. It has been a life-changer for me.Arrived several days ahead of scheduled delivery. My brother assembled it for me in about 30 minutes.If I could change one thing about it, it would be the arm rests - they are not adjustable. But for $50, I can live with it.
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United States on 30 January 2021

name: Vnewone Ergonomic Office Chair Desk Computer Mesh Executive Task Rolling Gaming Swivel Modern Adjustable with Mid Back Lumbar Support Armrest for Home Women Men, Black
reviews: Tal como la quer√≠a. Pero el repartidor la dejo en el cesped de la casa arriba de la hierba. Por eso no me lleg√≥ la foto de entrega.
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United States on 21 July 2022

name: Vnewone Ergonomic Office Chair Desk Computer Mesh Executive Task Rolling Gaming Swivel Modern Adjustable with Mid Back Lumbar Support Armrest for Home Women Men, Black
reviews: This chair certainly was affordable, and I expected the quality to be in line with the price. I expected that to primarily manifest in material quality and comfort, but something that I didn't consider was noise. After half a year, this thing squeaks loudly with even the smallest movement. I often work with headphones, but it becomes problematic for video meetings and it's to the point where I'm scared stiff (literally) during meetings as I try not to move or adjust my weight so as not to cause distractions for the meeting. Next time I'll just spend the money to buy a higher-quality chair.
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United States on 10 December 2021

name: Vnewone Ergonomic Office Chair Desk Computer Mesh Executive Task Rolling Gaming Swivel Modern Adjustable with Mid Back Lumbar Support Armrest for Home Women Men, Black
reviews: I guess you get what you pay for - I was disappointed that the seat cushion was about a half-inch taller on the left side than the right. I'm trying to even it out by adding a blanket folded so fewer layers are on the lower side. The challenge is I also had to add a two-inch seat cushion for this chair to be at an ergonomic height for a standard desk. Otherwise, the desk was higher than my elbows and therefore would not be at 90 degrees. I am 5' 5" tall - which is an average height for many women. I would not recommend this chair - the only good features were that it was easy to assemble and the back support would be great if I didn't have to raise myself up to get my elbows to the right height.  I guess if your tall and don't have back issues (like I do), sitting a tilt wouldn't bother you... but it sure bothers me since I have a herniated disc at L4-L5. The cushion I have to use brings my lower back up too high to enjoy the back support.
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United States on 26 July 2021

name: Vnewone Ergonomic Office Chair Desk Computer Mesh Executive Task Rolling Gaming Swivel Modern Adjustable with Mid Back Lumbar Support Armrest for Home Women Men, Black
reviews: Although I bought on prime day, it took like a month to get to me. But the wait was worth it. I found it easy to assemble in under an hour and it looks great in my classroom, the first chair i‚Äôve not stolen from another place. Would definitely purchase again, hopefully without the wait.
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United States on 16 August 2022

name: Vnewone Ergonomic Office Chair Desk Computer Mesh Executive Task Rolling Gaming Swivel Modern Adjustable with Mid Back Lumbar Support Armrest for Home Women Men, Black
reviews: The piston that keeps the chair at the proper height stopped working .  this is roughly five months of use.  I weight less than 200 pounds, so i can't see the weight as being the key reason.  Spend your money on a better quality chair
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United States on 15 July 2023

name: Vnewone Ergonomic Office Chair Desk Computer Mesh Executive Task Rolling Gaming Swivel Modern Adjustable with Mid Back Lumbar Support Armrest for Home Women Men, Black
reviews: Received the chair today, but one of the chair leg was not from the original chair itself. It was an attachable leg piece. Also, the chair is kind of small to holds a person who weights more than 200lbs, although the ads claims this chair can hold around 250lbs. I contact Amazon and I was asked if I wanted to return. Since the disassembly takes too much work for the return, so I was offered a discount for the chair. Overall, I feel so dissatisfied with this product, but Amazon customer service is a plus for issues resolve. So the 3 stars are for Amazon customer service not for the chair.
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United States on 22 July 2021

name: Vnewone Ergonomic Office Chair Desk Computer Mesh Executive Task Rolling Gaming Swivel Modern Adjustable with Mid Back Lumbar Support Armrest for Home Women Men, Black
reviews: Although the chair is pretty nice, my butt hurt after a couple hours of sitting in it.  Otherwise it did the job and for the price well, you can't go wrong, just use a cushion.

name: Vnewone Ergonomic Office Chair Desk Computer Mesh Executive Task Rolling Gaming Swivel Modern Adjustable with Mid Back Lumbar Support Armrest for Home Women Men, Black
reviews: You can sit, but like most office chairs your back will hurt after long periods of use
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United States on 15 May 2022

name: Vnewone Ergonomic Office Chair Desk Computer Mesh Executive Task Rolling Gaming Swivel Modern Adjustable with Mid Back Lumbar Support Armrest for Home Women Men, Black
reviews: Overall I give this product 3 stars. It is hard plastic with a mesh back so it is a rough back support. On my specific model the hydraulic system is broken and the chair will not stay in the air. It sinks down to the lowest position.When I ordered this product they also lost my order but I did receive the chair. This chair will work for now as I just moved into my new place, but once I get more money I will be getting a different chair.
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United States on 27 July 2021

name: Vnewone Ergonomic Office Chair Desk Computer Mesh Executive Task Rolling Gaming Swivel Modern Adjustable with Mid Back Lumbar Support Armrest for Home Women Men, Black
reviews: I have trouble with sciatica from time to time and this chair is very supportive during those times. I gave it 3 stars on assembly only because I was unable to get the handles to attach. However, I don't really like handles on a desk chair so it works fine for me without the handles.
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United States on 11 January 2021

name: Vnewone Ergonomic Office Chair Desk Computer Mesh Executive Task Rolling Gaming Swivel Modern Adjustable with Mid Back Lumbar Support Armrest for Home Women Men, Black
reviews: I had such a hard time finding a desk chair that delivered in LESS than 3 months that also wasn't HUNDREDS of dollars. Most places sell a stool for the same price. With no back support or arm rests. I go really down about this. I was working from home, at my desk sitting on my bed. Most days my back ached, but I would have flare ups and my back would be ON FIRE. Luckily, my MIL found this chair for me and I ordered it. It was at my house 6 days later. And it was SUPER easy to assemble.
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United States on 25 August 2020

name: Vnewone Ergonomic Office Chair Desk Computer Mesh Executive Task Rolling Gaming Swivel Modern Adjustable with Mid Back Lumbar Support Armrest for Home Women Men, Black
reviews: Had originally selected this chair around a year ago, when I was going into work for my personal desk at home. Started a WFH position around 7 months ago where I was sitting in it for hours almost every day. The mesh backing was not tight enough leading to the hard plastic backing jabbing my back so I needed to find a blanked to put over the back. The bottom cushion gave out about a month ago.I had to use other screws I had laying around for assembly because the ones they sent didn't fit, it creaked and squeaked constantly from day one. The base of the chair broke today after a year of use. The mesh backing was also ripping in a few spots.
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United States on 1 June 2022

name: Vnewone Ergonomic Office Chair Desk Computer Mesh Executive Task Rolling Gaming Swivel Modern Adjustable with Mid Back Lumbar Support Armrest for Home Women Men, Black

It sinks down to the lowest position.When I ordered this product they also lost my order but I did receive the chair. This chair will work for now as I just moved into my new place, but once I get more money I will be getting a different chair.
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United States on 27 July 2021

name: Vnewone Ergonomic Office Chair Desk Computer Mesh Executive Task Rolling Gaming Swivel Modern Adjustable with Mid Back Lumbar Support Armrest for Home Women Men, Black
reviews: I have trouble with sciatica from time to time and this chair is very supportive during those times. I gave it 3 stars on assembly only because I was unable to get the handles to attach. However, I don't really like handles on a desk chair so it works fine for me without the handles.
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United States on 11 January 2021

name: Vnewone Ergonomic Office Chair Desk Computer Mesh Executive Task Rolling Gaming Swivel Modern Adjustable with Mid Back Lumbar Support Armrest for Home Women Men, Black
reviews: I had such a hard time finding a desk chair that delivered in LESS than 3 months that also wasn't HUNDREDS of dollars. Most places sell a stool for the same price. With no back support or arm rests. I go really down about this. I was working from home, at my desk sitting on my bed. Most days my back ached, but I would have flare ups and my back would be ON FIRE. Luckily, my MIL found this chair for me and I ordered it. It was at my house 6 days later. And it was SUPER easy to assemble.
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United States on 25 August 2020

name: Vnewone Ergonomic Office Chair Desk Computer Mesh Executive Task Rolling Gaming Swivel Modern Adjustable with Mid Back Lumbar Support Armrest for Home Women Men, Black
reviews: Had originally selected this chair around a year ago, when I was going into work for my personal desk at home. Started a WFH position around 7 months ago where I was sitting in it for hours almost every day. The mesh backing was not tight enough leading to the hard plastic backing jabbing my back so I needed to find a blanked to put over the back. The bottom cushion gave out about a month ago.I had to use other screws I had laying around for assembly because the ones they sent didn't fit, it creaked and squeaked constantly from day one. The base of the chair broke today after a year of use. The mesh backing was also ripping in a few spots.
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United States on 1 June 2022

name: Vnewone Ergonomic Office Chair Desk Computer Mesh Executive Task Rolling Gaming Swivel Modern Adjustable with Mid Back Lumbar Support Armrest for Home Women Men, Black

date.of.review: Reviewed in the United States on 22 September 2020

name: Vnewone Ergonomic Office Chair Desk Computer Mesh Executive Task Rolling Gaming Swivel Modern Adjustable with Mid Back Lumbar Support Armrest for Home Women Men, Black

name: Vnewone Ergonomic Office Chair Desk Computer Mesh Executive Task Rolling Gaming Swivel Modern Adjustable with Mid Back Lumbar Support Armrest for Home Women Men, Black

name: Vnewone Ergonomic Office Chair Desk Computer Mesh Executive Task Rolling Gaming Swivel Modern Adjustable with Mid Back Lumbar Support Armrest for Home Women Men, Black
reviews: Received the chair today, but one of the chair leg was not from the original chair itself. It was an attachable leg piece. Also, the chair is kind of small to holds a person who weights more than 200lbs, although the ads claims this chair can hold around 250lbs. I contact Amazon and I was asked if I wanted to return. Since the disassembly takes too much work for the return, so I was offered a discount for the chair. Overall, I feel so dissatisfied with this product, but Amazon customer service is a plus for issues resolve. So the 3 stars are for Amazon customer service not for the chair.

name: Flash Furniture Mid Back Rotating Task Office Chair, Gray Mesh, Pivot Back, Arms Included
reviews: I bought this chair to work from home. I needed something small that would fit in a small space but still be comfortable. The assemble took about 40 minutes or so. The process could potentially go faster if you had some help. The instructions were not super great but it was doable. It does come with everything you need to assemble it. The chair shipped within a week which is not bad. It does come in the manufactures box so it's obvious what it is.The chair itself is small. Im 5'2" and it's almost like the perfect chair. I cant imagine a taller person enjoying this chair comfortably. Even at it's tallest I can still touch the floor which is not very common for me with office/task chairs. The cushion itself isn't the most comfortable but it will do. However, the back of the chair is very comfortable.
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United States on 29 July 2020

reviews: Nothing fancy - this is just your basic computer desk chair. It serves its intended purpose and functions as you would expect. Decent quality, does not make noises or comes loose. Not the hardest to assemble, but does require some effort as you would expect. If you're looking for comfort, this is not the chair. It is not comfortable to sit on for hours. But if you're just looking for a basic and affordable chair that won't be used for long periods of time, this chair is just fine.

name: Flash Furniture Mid Back Rotating Task Office Chair, Gray Mesh, Pivot Back, Arms Included
reviews: dont buy this, the back snapped off!!  It has a back that moves slightly, but watch out I was stretching and bam!!!!  It snapped and the whole chair went over with me in it.  Landing on my backside, tailbone, which is still bruised badly.  Would have sent a picture of that, but, figured not a good plan.  I have had 2 hips replaced and a wrist with hardware in it, so didn't feel good when I hit the hard floor, and I am still hurting.  O.K., I am 5'5", and weigh 135, so you would think it could handle that.  Another review the same as mine and he has gotten no where, come on amazon. I already have a bad back because of my illness, this hasn't helped!  What ever you do, don't let your mind drift while working at your desk in this chair and lean back to stretch (like it states you can), because you could end up on the floor!!  Buyer beware, don't buy, expect injuries!!!!!
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United States on 31 October 2023

name: Flash Furniture Mid Back Rotating Task Office Chair, Gray Mesh, Pivot Back, Arms Included
reviews: -Chair was pretty simple and easy for me to assemble-Felt comfortable to use at my desk and I was comfortable enough to do stuff for a good period of time-I have no idea how or why but when I went to sit back, not even a split second or a moment of comfort I'm pretty sure I saw my computer, the ceiling and the wall behind me in like less then 1 second and I couldn't tell if the snapping noise was the back support breaking or my spine cracking from going 90 degree sitting position to a 230 degree position.Though I didn't need medical attention but seeing how a lot of people having the same issues and looks like the same spot that's been breaking, felt a bit disheartened I really enjoyed the chair, but I cannot afford another one as in who knows if the second one will break and maybe I will need medical attention at that time.I tried attempting to go to the website and was trying to see if I could just get a replacement part or trying to communicate but damn that was so much of a hassle and it was faster to drive tot he next city over to a store and picked up a folding metal chair until a different desk chair was delivered

name: Flash Furniture High Back Office Chair | White LeatherSoft Office Chair with Wheels and Arms
reviews: I love the size!  It has a high back, but it's certainly space saving while having the comfort of a bigger chair.  Super easy to assemble!Nice hydrologic that absorbs shock when you sit.  Arm cushions and arm height feel nice, and so does the 'leather'.The white and chrome is upscale look that brightens the room.Its a rocking chair too!And I got it "like new" in all original packaging for an excellent discount price!  Very happy with my purchase!
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United States on 3 March 2023

name: Flash Furniture High Back Office Chair | White LeatherSoft Office Chair with Wheels and Arms
reviews: Sturdy, comfortable and nice looking.
date.of.review: Reviewed in Canada on 18 February 2021

name: Flash Furniture High Back Office Chair | White LeatherSoft Office Chair with Wheels and Arms
reviews: Es c√≥moda y se ve hermosa
date.of.review: Reviewed in Mexico on 22 June 2023

name: Flash Furniture High Back Office Chair | White LeatherSoft Office Chair with Wheels and Arms
reviews: This chair looked good on the Amazon website. I bought it as I specifically wanted a 'leather' chair. Unfortunately when it arrived it was made of a plastic/faux leather so I had to return it. If I had been happy with a faux leather chair I could have ordered one for less than the ¬£129.99 that I paid - and that was the reduced price in the Black Friday sale!
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 4 December 2023

name: Flash Furniture High Back Office Chair | White LeatherSoft Office Chair with Wheels and Arms
reviews: If you're buying this chair to sit in a corner and never be used, it's perfect! It looks good and stylish. But that's the only good about it.I had it for 2 days and the side arm that has material on it where you are always resting your arms has a tiny tear in it that looks like it's from overuse! 2 days.The material is sooo thin, it's like toilet paper. And porous so holds all the dirt and doesn't allow for wipe off because it will break!This thing is white! It needs to be sturdy for cleaning.It's super uncomfortable. You can't change the back angle at all and it's too straight.The padding of the seat is sooooo cheap. It has no bounce whatsoever. That's after 2 days! you can imagine what it will be like in 1 month.A very expensive piece of garbage. Do not buy.
date.of.review: Reviewed in Canada on 16 May 2022

name: Flash Furniture High Back Office Chair | White LeatherSoft Office Chair with Wheels and Arms
reviews: For the price the frame is of average quality but the PVC ‚Äúleather‚Äù is of a low quality. If I‚Äôd seen the chair for real in a shop I wouldn‚Äôt have bought it. After a couple of weeks use, the seat padding is already loosing its firmness.Would I recommend it‚Ä¶the honest answer is no.
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 10 August 2023

name: Flash Furniture High Back Office Chair | White LeatherSoft Office Chair with Wheels and Arms
reviews: Just received and put it together. First impressions: Assembly was pretty clear and straight forward and took about 20-30 mins. Comfortable seating so far, but you can tell that this is not a good quality item. Chair is already wobbling and not totally sturdy, and a bit smaller than expected. Originally this was posted on Amazon for much cheaper (less than $140), so they have hiked up the price quite a bit. For the current price listed ($238 + tax) I would not consider it and find something of better quality, or wait to purchase something very good for a little more that will surely last longer.
date.of.review: Reviewed in Canada on 17 July 2020

name: Flash Furniture High Back Office Chair | White LeatherSoft Office Chair with Wheels and Arms
reviews: The plastic wheels are cheaply produced and do not roll or spin freely.  This makes the chair drag over the carpet
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 1 January 2022

name: Flash Furniture High Back Office Chair | White LeatherSoft Office Chair with Wheels and Arms
reviewer: Muy bonita, f√°cil de armar, lleg√≥ muy bien. Recomendable. El cromado se ve muy bonito y elegante.
reviews: Lleg√≥ muy bien, si es una caja pesada, pero cabe en una cajuela. Es de muy buena calidad, ya lleva un mes de uso y est√° en perfecto estado. El cromado se ve muy bonito, y la diferencia de las sillas m√°s baratas, sin ser tan cara. Un diez. üëç
date.of.review: Reviewed in Mexico on 14 September 2023

name: Flash Furniture High Back Office Chair | White LeatherSoft Office Chair with Wheels and Arms
reviews: Overall, this chair was mostly fine with one serious problem: the back isn't well supported. It looks like a solid back but it's just a metal frame with fabric and elastic in the interior of the back. When I lean back into the chair, the back just gives way (see second picture). My last chair had a continuous board in the very back so that the back padding compressed against something sturdy. This chair just seems to have an elastic band buried in there. Even worse, I can feel it when I lean back. Another minor gripe is that the chair felt a bit small but that could just be that I'm used to somewhat oversized chairs and I like to sit cross-legged in the chair sometime.Other than that, the chair was fine. It arrived on time and undamaged. The packaging was reasonable and assembly was quick. There were some minor imperfections (first and third pictures) but nothing serious. Disassembly was a bit of a PITA but that's not really the manufacturer's fault.It looks pretty nice. Too bad it doesn't feel that nice.
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United States on 27 January 2024

name: Flash Furniture High Back Office Chair | White LeatherSoft Office Chair with Wheels and Arms
reviews: La esperaba m√°s c√≥moda y m√°s bonita

date.of.review: Reviewed in the United States on 29 July 2023

name: Flash Furniture High Back Office Chair | White LeatherSoft Office Chair with Wheels and Arms
reviews: Toughing it out because I love the aesthetic, but man, that seat is hard. I even got a cushion to help matters and it could only do so much. Be wary if you value comfort and having feeling in your butt at the end of the work day.
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United States on 19 November 2023

name: Flash Furniture High Back Office Chair | White LeatherSoft Office Chair with Wheels and Arms
reviews: UPDATE 1 Year Review: The positives I gave this chair some credit for on my initial reviews was looks and cushion. Well, after using this chair 3-5 days a week while working from home for a year, I can honestly say the initial cushion quality has gone out the window. The cushion has not held up....to the point where I‚Äôm shopping for a new chair already and I plan on spending a lot more money to get a sturdy, higher quality chair. This chai wobbles and moves in places it shouldn‚Äôt now, I feel the cheap sub material through the cushion now, and so honestly regret this purchase. It looks decent and is okay if you‚Äôre a lighter/smaller person it might be good for the only, but otherwise run away.I originally posted this review with a 4 star rating, but after working from home for a week on it, I am updating my review to sow a 3 star rating based on how uncomfortable I feel sitting in it for a long period of time. It has its upside but ultimately it is a small/tight fitting chair that is now with the money for taller people wanting it for regular use.Cons:I saw some reviews talking about how narrow the arm rests/seat area is. I figured these were picky or oversized people. Turns out they were right. Compared to my prior chair from Office Max, this chair is WAY more narrow. I‚Äôm 6‚Äô3‚Äù and ‚Äúnormal‚Äù sized/athletic shaped and slender....my hips are right at the arm rests (not touching but very close). Compared to my old chair, the arm rests also extend towards the front of the seat more....coupled with the narrow seat opening, the arm rests length makes it harder to get out of the chair at an angled direction. I have to swivel my chair completely sideways and stand up straight instead of partially turning and sliding in or out sideways. Also, the seat is not only narrow sideways but is is ‚Äúshort‚Äù longways.... sitting all the way back, the seat goes about halfway toward my knees.... my old chair went almost to my knee area (difference that is noticeable in comfort/weight distribution ). It seats almost like a driver side seat in a car given how most of your weight is on just your butt and instead of spread down your hamstrings, too. The chair just seems disproportionate and smaller than it should be. Smaller people might be good though. Last complaint is I ordered a black chair and they mailed me a white one. Easily fixed but still annoying and shouldn‚Äôt happen.Pros:Whatever shortcomings it has in comfort because of design/size, it at least got it right in the padding. This chair is one of the more comfortable home office chairs I‚Äôve sat in under $200 when it comes to the seat cushion. The padding seems to be thick and solid without being too supportive or too soft. Aside from that, the overall look is very sharp. The chrome is nicely done and spruces the chair‚Äôs appearance up. They did a good job on the overall look. Also, the chair went together quite easily. Packaging was good, too.Conclusion:While there is enough of a cramped seat feeling to make it worth 2 stars deduction, and if it was too much smaller I would have returned it, the chair is nice enough looking and cushioned enough to make the $105 chair worth keeping now that I have it...and at the end of the day it is just big enough to work. I work from home and have already spent several hours sitting and it seems to be a a decision I‚Äôll be able to live with, but I wouldn‚Äôt order it again if I could do it all over.
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United States on 2 May 2019

name: Flash Furniture High Back Office Chair | White LeatherSoft Office Chair with Wheels and Arms
reviews: This chair looks nice and is very comfortable. I really wish it came with a gold finish instead of chrome, but for the price you can't get everything you want. It came packed well and delivery was quick and easy. I put this together in about 45 minutes. I used a ratchet screwdriver instead of the Allen wrench provided. Many people said that the castors were hard to pop in,  but they popped right in for me. I gave this 4 stars instead of 5 for 2 reasons- first, the holes on the right side of the chair did not line up well. I would have had this chair put together much faster if it wasn't for this. After some trial and error, I had to complete the left side first (back and arm) in order to be able to pull the pieces together tight enough to make the holes line up on the right side.  Even then it was a struggle.  The other reason is that it can with a slight tear on the very back of the seat piece. It was covered once the back was put on, but it does raise concerns about the longevity of the chair. This is for a home office with limited usage, but I think if my dogs jump on it, it may tear. I will update this review if there are any issues. Overall, not a bad piece. Slightly overpriced for the issues. This was my first time putting a chair together.** update** Although the size of this chair is great for me at 5' tall, my husband (6') mentioned it being a little small for him. The seat is narrow and short. Not something I noticed, but he wouldn't be comfortable all day in it. He also noticed lots of ways to adjust the chair- I didn't realize you could adjust the lumbar support!
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United States on 3 February 2018
