reviews: ÁµÑ„ÅøÁ´ã„Å¶„ÇÇÁ∞°Âçò„ÅßË£ΩÂìÅ„ÇÇËâØ„ÅèÂ∫ß„ÇäÂøÉÂú∞„ÇÇËâØ„ÅÑ„Åß„Åô„ÄÇ„ÅÇ„Çä„Åå„Å®„ÅÜ„Åî„Åñ„ÅÑ„Åæ„Åó„Åü„ÄÇ
date.of.review: Reviewed in Japan on 3 October 2023

name: FDW (Factory Direct Wholesale) VNO-735-Black1 Office Chair, Black, Ergonomic Design, Lumbar Support, Armrest, Rolling Swivel, Adjustable, Mid Back Mesh, 22.8 x 23.2 x 39.0 inches (57.8 x 58.5 x 99
reviews: ...this chair is freakin' falling apart!I bought this chair in early June 2019. It was nice for just under a year. :( Then parts of it started breaking, ripping, tearing, coming apart... and getting very, very, very uncomfortable.Last night I tightened the screws again - maybe the sixth time since I got it - because it was squeaky and feeling very loose when I'm seated. None of the screws solved that issue. A couple were maybe one quarter turn loose, but none of them are what is causing this beast to squeak like a giant rat every time I move. The seat wobbles side to side, like it's breaking underneath. I've heard a couple sounds that sure sound like metal fracturing, but can't see where that's happening and nothing else I can tighten or change to make it comfortable again.The foam in the seat has completely worn out. It's flattened beyond flat. That happened relatively quickly for a chair rated to hold up to 400 lbs. Now there's a rectangle area the size of the seat support underneath that is very firmly raising up through the foam seat. This is making my hip joints and tail bone ache. A coccyx cushion helps a little, but then I'm up too high and it makes the back of my thighs hurt to sit that high, and I don't fit under the keyboard drawer either.It's always something. *sigh* I had high hopes for this chair.A month ago the rubber material on my right arm rest (or whatever it's made from) tore. Just flat out TORE. I had to duct tape it because no glue I have (and I have quite a few different types of permanent glue) would hold rubber to rubber. I've never had an armrest tear before.Maybe I shoulda tried rubber cement. Ha. Anyhow... it's duct taped. It is very scratchy to my right forearm and elbow, so there's a cloth tied over the arm rest. Looks quite "THERE I FIXED IT!" now. There's no way to buy just an arm rest, but with the infernal squeaking and the foam seat's demise, this chair's going to be relegated to the seldom-used category: the basement. Or the garage maybe. All it's good for now is doing a little bit of laundry for five minutes here or there.  I can't sit on this for my work-at-home job anymore. :(I'd really hoped I'd get at least 4-5 years of use out of this chair, but I barely made it the first year until it all started going wrong. I gave it 2 stars initially because it WAS easy to assemble, and for a while it was comfortable - maybe 8-10 months. Now I've edited to 1 star. The chair's seat is tilting forward with no way to get it to tilt back again. If I sit on it, I feel like I'm sliding off the seat forward. If I look at the chair from the side, it's very obvious that whatever the material (what is it, particle board?) is bending downwards on the front. Eventually, this chair will break in the seat and I'd wind up on the floor. :( I've tried adjusting the tilt knob underneath but nothing changes - tight, loose, all the same (to the chair, that is). There's a locking handle to control IF it tilts backward, but even that does not help. The chair's support is basically GONE. In a year. THAT should not happen. A chair rated as able to hold a heavier person should no way break down in a year. I bought it to replace a chair I'd had for well over 10 years. The back has, of course, tilted forward too, and there is simply no way to adjust that other than removing the back support entirely. There is no "back tilt mechanism" since it's screwed into the chair's seat.I wouldn't recommend this chair to anyone over 200 lbs. Keep looking if you're a heavier person. Just my humble opinion.
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United States on 13 October 2020

name: FDW (Factory Direct Wholesale) VNO-735-Black1 Office Chair, Black, Ergonomic Design, Lumbar Support, Armrest, Rolling Swivel, Adjustable, Mid Back Mesh, 22.8 x 23.2 x 39.0 inches (57.8 x 58.5 x 99
reviews: I purchased 2 of these chairs, one for a fairly large man, and one for an average sized woman.  They both really like the fit and comfort level of the chair.  The height adjustable feature works great, and the arm rests are also very adjustable, both up and down and they move closer/farther from the seat horizontally.  The seat cushion is very thick, so the height adjust feature is important for shorter individuals.  Price is very good for the quality of the product.  Quick shipping from the seller.
date.of.review: Reviewed in Canada on 13 August 2020

The back has, of course, tilted forward too, and there is simply no way to adjust that other than removing the back support entirely. There is no "back tilt mechanism" since it's screwed into the chair's seat.I wouldn't recommend this chair to anyone over 200 lbs. Keep looking if you're a heavier person. Just my humble opinion.
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United States on 13 October 2020

date.of.review: Reviewed in the United States on 7 January 2024

name: FDW (Factory Direct Wholesale) VNO-735-Black1 Office Chair, Black, Ergonomic Design, Lumbar Support, Armrest, Rolling Swivel, Adjustable, Mid Back Mesh, 22.8 x 23.2 x 39.0 inches (57.8 x 58.5 x 99
reviews: I bought this chair as it looked very similar to a chair I had working in an office before that I liked (near same design, a few less features), and with work from home my current chair has been getting a bit rough. Perfect time to upgrade right? I'm around 330 lbs so well under the max limit for the chair.Put this together today after receiving it. First warning sign was that one of the stickers was damaged/half-ripped (the FRONT sticker on the seat) showing me this is a refurb despite being told it was new. Also one of the permanent screws that comes pre-attached to the part that goes on the bottom of the chair and links with the gas mechanism looked super crooked. One item that according to the install guide wasn't supposed to already be attached was attached (the cover for the part where all of the wheels combine) so clearly someone had already had this. The packaging it came in was partially ripped. So yeah, even though they sell "new" these are 100% refurbs.Whatever, I still put it together alone without major issue and decide to sit on it. Quickly noticed that this wasn't near as comfortable as the similar chair I had at my office. I had known it would have less features (the one I had at the office let you move the seat forward/backward easily and had a very easy to use reclining feature that you could lock in any position but I was aware this one didn't have the first feature; it also had an easy adjustment to move the arms closer/further to the chair that this does not have, you need to unscrew and rescrew the arm to make an adjustment).It's wide, that's great and no complaint there. The chair goes up and down fine. The arms are good although because they are slightly loose to allow you to move them up and down they make a minor clacking noise if you touch them. Nothing major and mostly expected. The reclining feature barely works, it seems like the chair will break if I use it and makes a weird noise. I tried to turn the lock on it to the max both sides and it doesn't seem to have an impact.So it's a mediocre chair already, but why a 1?Literally within 2 minutes of sitting on this chair I started getting back pain, and that's sitting in the optimal position too, after adjusting the back part (to the best of my ability, I wish I could just remove the pillow completely because no position was 100% comfortable). Now, I haven't had back pain in a very long time, and I don't have chronic back pain at all. This came out of nowhere. I decided to give it a chance... it is a new chair, maybe I just needed to adjust. I tried to move around on the chair and if I don't sit in a perfect sitting position (IE if I shift forward and lay back a bit) the pain amplifies 200% so that's a no go. Well, it is an office chair so ok that sucks but what after 30 minutes later? The back pain was way worse and I had to give up at that point.I'm now back with my old beat up chair letting my lower back heal up. I've never returned an Amazon product before but I may very well do so for this chair... I'm shocked it has such a high rating. I didn't pay too much attention to the rating though as I know it's not always the end-all-be-all. I mostly thought this would be a good chair based on specifications + my experience with a model that looked similar, but it isn't even close to as comfortable. I wish I could find that exact model...Lesson learned, I will never buy a chair online again.
date.of.review: Reviewed in Canada on 30 November 2020

name: FDW (Factory Direct Wholesale) VNO-735-Black1 Office Chair, Black, Ergonomic Design, Lumbar Support, Armrest, Rolling Swivel, Adjustable, Mid Back Mesh, 22.8 x 23.2 x 39.0 inches (57.8 x 58.5 x 99
reviews: The part you sit on isnt very comfortable. Its extremely flat but for the price i paid, i cant complain too much. It says ergonomic but my back does constantly hurt sitting in it. date.of.review: Reviewed in Japan on 3 October 2023

name: FDW (Factory Direct Wholesale) VNO-735-Black1 Office Chair, Black, Ergonomic Design, Lumbar Support, Armrest, Rolling Swivel, Adjustable, Mid Back Mesh, 22.8 x 23.2 x 39.0 inches (57.8 x 58.5 x 99
reviews: ...this chair is freakin' falling apart!I bought this chair in early June 2019. It was nice for just under a year. :( Then parts of it started breaking, ripping, tearing, coming apart... and getting very, very, very uncomfortable.Last night I tightened the screws again - maybe the sixth time since I got it - because it was squeaky and feeling very loose when I'm seated. None of the screws solved that issue. A couple were maybe one quarter turn loose, but none of them are what is causing this beast to squeak like a giant rat every time I move. The seat wobbles side to side, like it's breaking underneath. I've heard a couple sounds that sure sound like metal fracturing, but can't see where that's happening and nothing else I can tighten or change to make it comfortable again.The foam in the seat has completely worn out. It's flattened beyond flat. That happened relatively quickly for a chair rated to hold up to 400 lbs. Now there's a rectangle area the size of the seat support underneath that is very firmly raising up through the foam seat. This is making my hip joints and tail bone ache. A coccyx cushion helps a little, but then I'm up too high and it makes the back of my thighs hurt to sit that high, and I don't fit under the keyboard drawer either.It's always something. *sigh* I had high hopes for this chair.A month ago the rubber material on my right arm rest (or whatever it's made from) tore. Just flat out TORE. I had to duct tape it because no glue I have (and I have quite a few different types of permanent glue) would hold rubber to rubber. I've never had an armrest tear before.Maybe I shoulda tried rubber cement. Ha. Anyhow... it's duct taped. It is very scratchy to my right forearm and elbow, so there's a cloth tied over the arm rest. Looks quite "THERE I FIXED IT!" now. There's no way to buy just an arm rest, but with the infernal squeaking and the foam seat's demise, this chair's going to be relegated to the seldom-used category: the basement. Or the garage maybe. All it's good for now is doing a little bit of laundry for five minutes here or there.  I can't sit on this for my work-at-home job anymore. :(I'd really hoped I'd get at least 4-5 years of use out of this chair, but I barely made it the first year until it all started going wrong. I gave it 2 stars initially because it WAS easy to assemble, and for a while it was comfortable - maybe 8-10 months. Now I've edited to 1 star. The chair's seat is tilting forward with no way to get it to tilt back again. If I sit on it, I feel like I'm sliding off the seat forward. If I look at the chair from the side, it's very obvious that whatever the material (what is it, particle board?) is bending downwards on the front. Eventually, this chair will break in the seat and I'd wind up on the floor. :( I've tried adjusting the tilt knob underneath but nothing changes - tight, loose, all the same (to the chair, that is). There's a locking handle to control IF it tilts backward, but even that does not help. The chair's support is basically GONE. In a year. THAT should not happen. A chair rated as able to hold a heavier person should no way break down in a year. I bought it to replace a chair I'd had for well over 10 years. The back has, of course, tilted forward too, and there is simply no way to adjust that other than removing the back support entirely. There is no "back tilt mechanism" since it's screwed into the chair's seat.I wouldn't recommend this chair to anyone over 200 lbs. Keep looking if you're a heavier person. Just my humble opinion.
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United States on 13 October 2020

name: Flash Furniture Low Back Designer Armless White Ribbed Swivel Task Office Chair
reviews: I was worried that this chair, as thin as it was, would be uncomfortable.  But it provides cushion and support at all the necessary places, especially the lower back, without looking like a couch.  I got the chair in white, and it really is a lovely piece of furniture for only $80.  The height is easily adjustable while sitting on it, using the lever under the seat.  The chair took just a few minutes to assemble; there were only 4 screws to screw in, using the allen wrench that came with it.  The vinyl is super soft, which makes me wonder how durable it will be, but for $80, if it gets a rip, I'll just buy a new chair!
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United States on 22 June 2023

name: Drafting Chair Tall Office Chair Adjustable Height with Lumbar Support Flip Up Arms Footrest Mid Back Task Mesh Desk Chair Computer Chair Drafting Stool for Standing Desk, Black
reviews: In a range of 1-10 most of the time while assembling this chair I felt that a 10 plus was in order. The screws had loctite on them. Are you kidding me, nobody does that, they usuall  leave us to forgo an essential ingredient when tightening things up. The protective packaging was hand tight not requiring anything that would draw blood.  The instructions were black and white drawings that were informative. The tool for installing had the correct length and leverage to ensure the correct torque would/could be applied. The bolt heads that are not visible have caps available to clean things up. Just an example of how well this chair has been designed and built. I did have one problem and that was one of the wheel sockets had been slightly compressed and required that I clamp the wheel axle into place. This chair is so comfortable that while I was testing it for comfort I started to nod off. I fully expect this chair to aid in producing an enjoyable experience while at my work station.
date.of.review: Reviewed in Canada on 10 November 2021

name: Drafting Chair Tall Office Chair Adjustable Height with Lumbar Support Flip Up Arms Footrest Mid Back Task Mesh Desk Chair Computer Chair Drafting Stool for Standing Desk, Black
reviews: I bought this chair for my job, it serves me about 10-20 hours a week, and I use it 100% at its maximum height. I usually work standing up and only sit for a few minutes an hour. I like the fact that this chair has a footrest. The chair turns smoothly, and the arms are easily raised. The back support is relatively average but not uncomfortable. The casters work well. The foam used for the chair is relatively comfortable, but I'm afraid the foam will sag over time.The assembly of the chair was relatively easy and quick.***DIMENSION***-The height of the assembled chair:-Back between 42 1/2 and 50 1/2 inches- Armrests between 29 3/4 and 37 3/4 inches-Seat between 21 1/2 and 29 1/2 inches*** IN THE BOX, THERE IS ****-Chair-Installation manual (basic)*** FEATURES ***-The wheels (5) work well-The armrests are easily adjusted-Adjustable and comfortable back support despite being made of plastic-The footrest is interesting-Allows you to do 360 degrees with the chair*** PRODUCT PACKAGING ***-A very standard box****CONCLUSION***Overall, I am relatively happy with the product. I hesitated for a long time before choosing this chair. I was looking for a chair that could be lifted enough to work on my "sit and stand" desk when it is up. This chair is versatile, affordable and comfortable, but it will not last 20 years like my last chair.-------------J‚Äôai achet√© cette chaise pour mon travail, elle me sert environ 10-20 heures par semaine et je l‚Äôutilise 100% √† sa hauteur maximale. Je travaille en g√©n√©ral debout et je m‚Äôassois que quelques minutes par heure. J‚Äôaime bien le fait que cette chaise propose un repose-pied. La chaise tourne ais√©ment et les bras se l√®vent facilement. Le support du dos est plut√¥t moyen, mais pas inconfortable. Les roulettes fonctionnent bien. La mousse utilis√©e pour la chaise est relativement confortable, mais j‚Äôai bien peur qu‚Äôavec le temps la mousse s‚Äôaffaisse.Le montage de la chaise fut relativement facile et rapide.***DIMENSION***-La hauteur de la chaise assembl√©e : -Dossier entre 42 1/2 et 50 1/2 pouces -Accoudoirs entre 29 3/4 et 37 3/4 pouces -Assise entre 21 1/2 et 29 1/2 pouces***DANS LA BOITE, IL Y A****-Chaise-Manuel d‚Äôinstallation (de base)***FONCTIONNALIT√âS***-Les roues (5) fonctionnent bien-Les accoudoirs s‚Äôajustent facilement-Le support dorsal ajustable et confortable malgr√© qu‚Äôil soit en plastique-Le repose-pied est int√©ressant-Permets de faire un 360 degr√©s avec la chaise***EMBALLAGE DU PRODUIT***-Une boite bien normale****CONCLUSION***Dans l‚Äôensemble, je suis relativement satisfait du produit. J‚Äôai h√©sit√© longtemps avant de choisir cette chaise. Je cherchais une chaise qui pouvait √™tre assez lev√©e pour que je puisse travailler sur mon bureau ‚Äò‚Äôsit and stand‚Äô lorsqu‚Äôil est lev√©. Cette chaise est polyvalente, abordable et confortable, mais il est clair qu‚Äôelle ne durera pas 20 ans comme ma derni√®re chaise.

reviews: Wold be not bad stool but.....:1/ Despite the sit is absolutely horizontal (I even checked with the level)  it's always a feeling like you sliding down all the time. Like front side of the sit is like tilted lower than the sit's back side (but it's not) and the construction not allow  to tilt the sit bit backward.2/ And the worst: kind of strong chemical smell comes out from the sit. I have the chair for few days and maybe the smell will go away after some time. But who knows after how long time. Tried to spray with little fragrance (I cannot use a lot of fragrance because I don't like that too)  but the awful chemical smell comes back shortly.  And that is - the smell - the worst thing  for meWould like to return, but I threw out the packing box.If not those two things the stool would be not bad for me.P.S. Now,  about 2-3 weeks later I can tell than I can increase the rating  1/ I became used to the feeling that the  sit  is tilted, but anyway I would prefer if the sit's front edge would be slightly more up  2/ The chemical smell is goneThat's why I increase the rating from 2 stars to 4.

reviews: Do NOT waste your money on this chair or with this store!Within a week of use it bent on TWO axes. If the forward tilt doesn't drop you out of the chair, the dropping tilt to the right front corner will make you twist your back so bad you wont be able to walk straight when you get out of this thing.Unfortunately we purchased this chair while planning out my wife's work from home space, wanted to have it on hand first so I could plan out the sit/stand desk I was building her, so it sat in a box for almost 3 months before we assembled and started to use it. The company won't help since it's "over 90 days" (by a whole 8 days when I contacted them) even though it had been in use for less than 3 weeks. The didn't ask about the nature of the issue, for photos, or anything. They had their get-out-of-jail-free card with the 90 days and didn't give a damn beyond that.I'd rate in the negatives if I could.Stay away from this product and this store.

Tried to spray with little fragrance (I cannot use a lot of fragrance because I don't like that too)  but the awful chemical smell comes back shortly.  And that is - the smell - the worst thing  for meWould like to return, but I threw out the packing box.If not those two things the stool would be not bad for me.P.S. Now,  about 2-3 weeks later I can tell than I can increase the rating  1/ I became used to the feeling that the  sit  is tilted, but anyway I would prefer if the sit's front edge would be slightly more up  2/ The chemical smell is goneThat's why I increase the rating from 2 stars to 4.

name: Flash Furniture Mid-Back White Mesh Swivel Ergonomic Task Office Chair with White Frame and Flip-Up Arms
reviews: The chair is beautiful to look at, and if you are petite (I'm 5'3) it's the perfect height at almost it's lowest setting so it would still be good if you're a little taller. Your legs are at a good 90 degree angle and the waterfall seat allows circulation behind the knees. I tend to sit cross-legged often and the arms don't get in the way. The seat is firm but comfortable and I like that the arms are padded and can be lifted up to tuck under my desk. They are the perfect height for me leaving my elbows bent at a 90¬∞ angle. The arms are little too far apart from the body though but that's not a deal breaker for me. The lumbar support is not adjustable but hits me at the perfect spot.The reason for the lower rating is because of the price. Like another reviewer, my chair came with the underside of the wheel housing rusty-looking (even though the material is not metal) and it was impossible to get the stains out (maybe I got that chair that they returned). I got an amazon warehouse deal so for what I paid, I decided to keep it as the staining is on the underside of the legs and not visible. The rest of the chair looks great and in great condition. The wheels turn smoothly and it has a good amount of lean back.At $300 though, I would be upset about the staining. I would still give this chair a shot, just look out for the staining and return it if it's there. Otherwise, it's worth it.
date.of.review: Reviewed in Canada on 31 March 2022

name: Flash Furniture Mid-Back White Mesh Swivel Ergonomic Task Office Chair with White Frame and Flip-Up Arms
reviews: First I loved the chair. But after a period something broke and I noticed it was the wood inside the seat.  When I lean back it leans to one side due to this. I truly despise it. The product should be more sustainable. I use it every day and I feel that it was a waste of my investment. Also the arms screws loosen up after weeks and to tighten them I need to open up the chair. Have done it mutiple times now. The backside broke from the seat side due to the pressure of only four bolts bolted in the wooden seat. I contacted the company but never ever received a response. If you want to buy something that will last and is comfortable. Do NOT buy this product!!
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 25 May 2023

name: Flash Furniture Mid-Back White Mesh Swivel Ergonomic Task Office Chair with White Frame and Flip-Up Arms
reviews: Produit confortable. N√©anmoins, je pensais que le dossier pouvait se pencher en arri√®re, ce n'est pas le cas.Montage du dossier un peu plus compliqu√© car les trous ne sont pas align√©s. Mais il suffit de ne pas trop serrer les vis pour garder un peu de mobilit√© afin de pouvoir aligner les trous et visser fermement par la suite.
date.of.review: Reviewed in France on 21 August 2021

name: Flash Furniture Mid-Back White Mesh Swivel Ergonomic Task Office Chair with White Frame and Flip-Up Arms
reviews: Perfect for gaming. Easy to assemble and very comfortable.

name: Flash Furniture Mid-Back White Mesh Swivel Ergonomic Task Office Chair with White Frame and Flip-Up Arms
reviews: People have said that this chair is difficult to put together, it isn't. That the holes don't line up, they do. That it's not comfortable, it is.The fixing bolts are easily cross-threaded, which is perhaps why people said the holes didn't line up, so if you are putting it together and the bolts feel stiff, don't press your luck, you are probably cross-threading them and this will end badly. Basically, if the bolts don't go in easily, you are doing it wrong. Mind you, be aware that the bolts come with thread lock applied so they will become a little harder to screw in after a few turns, this is normal with thread-lock.So far, the chair has been comfy, not too bad a height and feels sturdy.It's not mentioned anywhere but the seat height is 45cm.
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 13 October 2023

name: Flash Furniture Mid-Back White Mesh Swivel Ergonomic Task Office Chair with White Frame and Flip-Up Arms
reviews: Was looking for a new chair to replace my old chair from my set-up. I settled on something cheap since I wouldn't need it for took long and wanted something that was better than the last and good looking.I looked at other chairs and some of them just seemed off, the reviews didn't provide a good feeling so I skipped out on them. But whilst browsing the reviews on this chair I couldn't see anything wrong. Some complaints about squeaky parts, hard to assemble and stuff like that. My first impression since I just got it today is that it is a solid and comfy chair that is also stylish.I got the black frame and white mesh option and it fits in great with my room theme. The overall design is pretty neat with decent support for your back and feels pretty normal size. The armrests on nonadjustable but can go up if you wish not to use them. The putting together of the chair may require some help or nifty way but it's no reason to not buy it. My parts mostly aligned and caused no fuss when assembling. I had the thing put together in about 30 mins with a little help. The instructions aren't the best but it's pretty easy to just use your brain to put it together.The feeling of the mesh is soft and breathable. The cushion is nice and padded, the arm rest are very padded a little more for my liking but that is probably because they are new. Overall I rated it a 4/5, certainly was a little above what I was expecting and was happy with the purchase. Good chair for a decent price.
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United States on 31 January 2021

name: Flash Furniture Mid-Back White Mesh Swivel Ergonomic Task Office Chair with White Frame and Flip-Up Arms

name: Flash Furniture Mid-Back White Mesh Swivel Ergonomic Task Office Chair with White Frame and Flip-Up Arms
reviews: I love this chair. I bought the one without wheels. I can sit for long periods of time with any fatigue at all. I loved it so much that I purchased a 2nd one for my bedroom where I sometimes go on line or play games. The base is perfect and leaves no marks on my rug. If I were to use it in a room without a rug, such as my kitchen I would simply add some felt pads as I have done with other chairs to avoid marks. The arms flip up and make getting up or sitting down a cinch. Easy and quick to assemble. Nice back support and no sweating or sticking. I noticed it's available with a non fabric seat and that one may not provide the same comfort as this one. I didn't think that it would work for me without wheels but I was pleased this model.

reviews: I love this chair. I bought the one without wheels. I can sit for long periods of time with any fatigue at all. I loved it so much that I purchased a 2nd one for my bedroom where I sometimes go on line or play games. The base is perfect and leaves no marks on my rug. If I were to use it in a room without a rug, such as my kitchen I would simply add some felt pads as I have done with other chairs to avoid marks. The arms flip up and make getting up or sitting down a cinch. Easy and quick to assemble. Nice back support and no sweating or sticking. I noticed it's available with a non fabric seat and that one may not provide the same comfort as this one. I didn't think that it would work for me without wheels but I was pleased this model.
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United States on 25 February 2021

name: Flash Furniture Mid-Back White Mesh Swivel Ergonomic Task Office Chair with White Frame and Flip-Up Arms
reviews: Assembly went quick enough. Chair is sturdy and comfortable but needs an upgrade for the foam in the seat 'cause it flattens out a lot after sitting awhile. Higher density foam in the seat would be better.
date.of.review: Reviewed in Canada on 15 April 2022

name: Flash Furniture Mid-Back White Mesh Swivel Ergonomic Task Office Chair with White Frame and Flip-Up Arms
reviews: Great support in all the right places.  Very comfortable.  Looks great
date.of.review: Reviewed in Canada on 18 November 2021

name: Flash Furniture Mid-Back White Mesh Swivel Ergonomic Task Office Chair with White Frame and Flip-Up Arms
reviews: The chair is good quality and very easy to assemble. I did it without the instructions and it took me maybe 10 minutes. It‚Äôs really comfortable and I love that it is not a rolling chair and that the arms go up and down. My son also loves this chair for home schooling. I wouldn‚Äôt have bought this chair at regular price keep in mind, but if you can get on sale it‚Äôs worth it.
date.of.review: Reviewed in Canada on 15 May 2021

name: Flash Furniture Mid-Back White Mesh Swivel Ergonomic Task Office Chair with White Frame and Flip-Up Arms
reviews: Just as advertised, very sturdy (but heavy) office chair with nice leather seat and armrests that swing up and down. Chair is a bit low for me, would be better if height adjustable. Like that it doesn‚Äôt have wheels.

reviews: The chair is nice and very comfortable. My 14 yr old put it together. He is happy. The box however should be h- taped instead of a single strip on the bottom. The screw package was opened thus 2 or 3 washers were missing from the box. Luckily, we had some from the garage to use.  The chair arrived with a small hole in the backing and a paint chip on the leg. I was disappointed by that, I hope it holds up without more holes.

name: Flash Furniture Mid-Back White Mesh Swivel Ergonomic Task Office Chair with White Frame and Flip-Up Arms

I spent 10 minutes to fix one screw and in the end I replace the screw with another one and it's all done. I guess the quality control of the screw needs improvement!

reviews: 6 months in, and it is bending already. When I sit in it, the chair is now leaning HEAVILY to the right. Way off center. I am 300lbs, well below the rated weight.
date.of.review: Reviewed in Japan on 16 August 2022

name: Big and Tall Office Chair Ergonomic Chair 400lbs Wide Seat Executive Desk Chair with Lumbar Support Adjustable Armrest Headrest High Back Mesh Computer Chair Rolling Swivel Task Chair(Black)
reviews: Had a few months and the chair has a lean to it now, Starting to hurt my back, Terrible product. I am only 300 lbs and It didn't last at all.Impossible to contact seller.AVOID at all costs. Huge waste of money.
date.of.review: Reviewed in Canada on 6 December 2021

name: Big and Tall Office Chair Ergonomic Chair 400lbs Wide Seat Executive Desk Chair with Lumbar Support Adjustable Armrest Headrest High Back Mesh Computer Chair Rolling Swivel Task Chair(Black)
reviews: The chair is very well made and was easy to put together.  It is large enough to hold a larger person.  It is also comfortable to sit in for a longer period of time.  The arm height adjusts for comfort, too.
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United States on 13 June 2021

name: Big and Tall Office Chair Ergonomic Chair 400lbs Wide Seat Executive Desk Chair with Lumbar Support Adjustable Armrest Headrest High Back Mesh Computer Chair Rolling Swivel Task Chair(Black)
reviews: Less than 1 year old, parts keep loosening, falling off and the base broke where the piston goes in and is not repairable... I would look elsewhere if you are a larger person.Would not recommend.
date.of.review: Reviewed in Canada on 12 February 2022

name: Big and Tall Office Chair Ergonomic Chair 400lbs Wide Seat Executive Desk Chair with Lumbar Support Adjustable Armrest Headrest High Back Mesh Computer Chair Rolling Swivel Task Chair(Black)
reviews: I bought this because my computer desk is a little higher than normal. in a regular office chair my elbows are lower than my wrists causing the area just above my wrist to dig into the edge of the table. 30 minutes of that and hands fall asleep.went together fast and fairly easy. seat is a little hard, but then it is made for someone heavy (I'm 6 foot 177 pounds). but I bet it just needs breaking in a little. the arms are a tad uncomfortable as they are concaved and if your arm is not lined up with depression they gently dig into your forarm (still better than the hard edge of my desk). other than that, can't beat it for the money.
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United States on 26 March 2021

name: Big and Tall Office Chair Ergonomic Chair 400lbs Wide Seat Executive Desk Chair with Lumbar Support Adjustable Armrest Headrest High Back Mesh Computer Chair Rolling Swivel Task Chair(Black)
reviews: I'm not usually one to write negative reviews, but I'm definitely a bit disappointed in this chair. For the first few months it was fantastic - the cushion is comfortable, and the mesh back is great if you're the type that gets hot sitting in a leather or faux leather seat for chunks of time.I purchased the chair in July of 2022. It's March of 2023 and I'm already looking for a replacement after just 7ish months of use. I'm certainly below the rated weight limit, and despite that, I started encountering slow-but-consistent issues gradually popping up.The first thing to go was the screw that holds the left armrest in place (pictured). It somehow went straight through the foam-like material and ruined that armrest when I leaned against it. I got an annoying cut from it, but with some repositioning, I was able to get it into a decent enough position to be workable ...until the right armrest screw straight up fell out about a month later.After both armrests had their issues, the mechanism that stops you from leaning back all the way started acting up. As opposed to leaning straight back, it now leans back and to the side in a way that makes you feel like it will topple at any moment.Finally, and the straw that broke the camel's back this week, was the lift function stopping. You can lift the chair as high as it will go, and then very slowly sink back down to its lowest point while you're sitting. I'm glad to have an adjustable desk that I can lower to fit the chair's lowest point while I shop for a new one, but my desk is now at knee height, which isn't super fun.Considering the price, I shouldn't have had super high expectations - you get what you pay for. At the same time, it would have been nice to last at least a year? Instead I got a little over half a year of experiencing a new problem popping out of the blue to surprise me each month.
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United States on 2 March 2023

name: Big and Tall Office Chair Ergonomic Chair 400lbs Wide Seat Executive Desk Chair with Lumbar Support Adjustable Armrest Headrest High Back Mesh Computer Chair Rolling Swivel Task Chair(Black)
reviews: For a chair that is meant for 400lbs this chair slowly loses height.  We have only had it for 2.5 months.  I will file a claim.
date.of.review: Reviewed in Canada on 16 September 2022

name: Big and Tall Office Chair Ergonomic Chair 400lbs Wide Seat Executive Desk Chair with Lumbar Support Adjustable Armrest Headrest High Back Mesh Computer Chair Rolling Swivel Task Chair(Black)
reviews: I picked this chair for a full time home office set up. The assembly was typical for a chair of this type. For two years, it was mostly comfortable and did the job of me not thinking about what was supporting my large body while I was doing my job.The last month or so, I was starting to feel more aches after sitting in it. This last week, it was wobbly and very unstable to sit in. As I was switching the chair out with its replacement, my cat jumped on it and that was the final stress that broke the chair that I had for 2.5 years. The photo is the underside of the chair with the metal plate that failed to attach to the hydrolic shaft.
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United States on 24 November 2023

name: Big and Tall Office Chair Ergonomic Chair 400lbs Wide Seat Executive Desk Chair with Lumbar Support Adjustable Armrest Headrest High Back Mesh Computer Chair Rolling Swivel Task Chair(Black)
reviews: I‚Äôm 6 ft 440 with pretty wide hips and thighs and I fit this chair perfectly. It makes me feel like something was actually made for me. It‚Äôs crazy that skinny people get to feel like that all the time. Just comfortable in every setting. Anywho. It‚Äôs roomy and the arm rests adjust up and down so they don‚Äôt dig into your thighs at all. I have mine as high as they go. 4 stars cause the seat could use a way thicker/more plush cushion. It‚Äôs pretty dense.
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United States on 15 March 2023

name: Big and Tall Office Chair Ergonomic Chair 400lbs Wide Seat Executive Desk Chair with Lumbar Support Adjustable Armrest Headrest High Back Mesh Computer Chair Rolling Swivel Task Chair(Black)
reviews: The only thing that bothers me is that when I went to tighten one of the pieces under the cushion, it made a cracking sound and now I head that all the time. I wasn't sure if I was supposed to just make it a snug fit while tightening though.Still extremely comfortable. I like the arch support for my lower back to help me sit up straight.
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United States on 7 April 2023

name: Big and Tall Office Chair Ergonomic Chair 400lbs Wide Seat Executive Desk Chair with Lumbar Support Adjustable Armrest Headrest High Back Mesh Computer Chair Rolling Swivel Task Chair(Black)
reviews: Feels goodNot the best butIt is better then paying more
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United States on 10 August 2023

name: Big and Tall Office Chair Ergonomic Chair 400lbs Wide Seat Executive Desk Chair with Lumbar Support Adjustable Armrest Headrest High Back Mesh Computer Chair Rolling Swivel Task Chair(Black)
reviews: When I first got this chair it was easy to put together, but there was a broken cosmetic part that only affected the look of the chair from behind in a minor way. The comfort of it initially was actually quite good, but a month later the cushion was flat and I had to find myself an additional seat cushion.Otherwise, this chair has been fairly solid, though it seems the padding of the arms isn't properly screwed on as the screw fell out of it and I had to put it back in and it wouldn't really tighten down. It was as if the screw was screwed into the soft underside of the rubber arm padding itself rather than a pilot hole that is properly anchored into the padding.Over all, this chair was a very average to below average experience, which is upsetting as I was hoping to find something comfortable but I suppose you pay for what you get. This chair will do in a pinch but you very much need an additional seat cushion and hope that the parts you do receive are complete and undamaged.
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United States on 28 October 2021

name: Big and Tall Office Chair Ergonomic Chair 400lbs Wide Seat Executive Desk Chair with Lumbar Support Adjustable Armrest Headrest High Back Mesh Computer Chair Rolling Swivel Task Chair(Black)
reviews: Got this cause I be a big big.  280 lbs.  Seems to work well, the headrest is made cheap, mounted even cheaper.  I have a small pillow from another desk chair that I have added to do the headrest job better.
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United States on 5 April 2023

name: Big and Tall Office Chair Ergonomic Chair 400lbs Wide Seat Executive Desk Chair with Lumbar Support Adjustable Armrest Headrest High Back Mesh Computer Chair Rolling Swivel Task Chair(Black)
reviews: (See end of review for update)Bought this over some cheaper gamer-style chairs because it looked more solidly built - areas that would be plastic on other chairs are rolled steel tubing such as the bottom arms where the wheels attach, the struts that hold the arms on, the connection between back and seat, etc. Brass insets for where the screws attach to the interior of the seat cushion so they won't rip out over time. Instructions are good and easy to follow, just look closely at the pictures (very few words, but diagrams are clear). Comes with an assembly tool and a few extra screws in case you misplace any (though just one extra of each). Chair seems well-built relative to other things in this price range, though still manufactured in China. Some adjustment on the width of the arms when assembling (or after if you flip it over and adjust the screws, ~1in. of travel in either direction). Seated position is a little forward with rock back tension that can be adjusted, but no lock back (only lock horizontal). Would say this is designed more as a productivity chair than say a gaming chair - can't lock back in reclined position, but this is more what I wanted anyway. Typical gas piston height adjustment. Seat cushion is both thick and comfortable. Back is high and well suited to taller people (why I bought this chair).Edit: Seemed good at first but broke within six months. Can't even figure out what's causing it to lean to one side now, all screws retightened but it still has an odd leftwards list to it.
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United States on 14 March 2021

name: Big and Tall Office Chair Ergonomic Chair 400lbs Wide Seat Executive Desk Chair with Lumbar Support Adjustable Armrest Headrest High Back Mesh Computer Chair Rolling Swivel Task Chair(Black)
reviews: Chair is rated to 400 lbs.  I weigh 280.  I have worked from home ever since I bought the chair so I spend 8-10 hours per weekday sitting in this chair.  The cushion in the seat was comfortable for the first ~6 months.  After that, I had to have a pad on top of the seat in order to sit comfortably.  Unfortunately, the pad raised the seat height too much and, over time, I ended up with ergonomic issues in my neck.  I cannot recommend this chair as my experience with its durability has been poor.  Besides the seat, the rest of the chair is still in good functional shape but what good is a chair that you can't sit on?
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United States on 2 July 2022

name: Big and Tall Office Chair Ergonomic Chair 400lbs Wide Seat Executive Desk Chair with Lumbar Support Adjustable Armrest Headrest High Back Mesh Computer Chair Rolling Swivel Task Chair(Black)
reviews: Chair is wobbly after 6 months. I'm under 250 lbs.  The chair is rated for 400 lbs.  The gas piston seems ok but the mechanism is damaged. I spent $150 originally and the spare parts is $90.00.Chair is crap.
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United States on 25 November 2023

name: Big and Tall Office Chair Ergonomic Chair 400lbs Wide Seat Executive Desk Chair with Lumbar Support Adjustable Armrest Headrest High Back Mesh Computer Chair Rolling Swivel Task Chair(Black)
reviews: This chair needs much thicker padding on the seat. There's about an inch and a half worth of foam between you and a hard metal base, and after awhile, you feel like you're sitting on the bleachers at a sporting event. I always end up sitting on a bed pillow for comfort. I'm actually on Amazon today to shop for a chair cushion.
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United States on 11 April 2023

name: Big and Tall Office Chair Ergonomic Chair 400lbs Wide Seat Executive Desk Chair with Lumbar Support Adjustable Armrest Headrest High Back Mesh Computer Chair Rolling Swivel Task Chair(Black)
reviews: Got the chair and part of the back plastic was broken (not anything structural). Customer support took care of me really quickly.These chairs aren't the most comfortable ever, but I've used a chair from this company for at least a year now without issue and it gets the job done. That's why I bought this one - I needed one for my home office and don't want to spend a fortune on a chair.I'm fat and these chairs have held together more than any other chair I've had previously.
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United States on 6 March 2022

name: Big and Tall Office Chair Ergonomic Chair 400lbs Wide Seat Executive Desk Chair with Lumbar Support Adjustable Armrest Headrest High Back Mesh Computer Chair Rolling Swivel Task Chair(Black)
reviews: This was easy to assemble and although I am apprehensive about breaking the chair it is holding up very well.  Two negative points.  The first and biggest issue is the actual seat is VERY hard.  I have two different types of seat cushions to make it tolerable.  The other issue the headrest.  It is only really usable when you are leaning all the way back and reclining.  There is no way to adjust the headrest it to use for support while sitting up.  I will add that there is a good lower lumbar support in the chair back.
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United States on 9 April 2021

name: Big and Tall Office Chair Ergonomic Chair 400lbs Wide Seat Executive Desk Chair with Lumbar Support Adjustable Armrest Headrest High Back Mesh Computer Chair Rolling Swivel Task Chair(Black)
reviews: This is a great chair for the price. I was grateful I could leave off the top headrest.The width is great, but the seat cushion could be a little more durable. I suspect it will wear out and go flat soon, but I don't know that for a fact. A lumbar cushion will solve that issue.
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United States on 7 August 2022

reviews: Got the chair and part of the back plastic was broken (not anything structural). Customer support took care of me really quickly.These chairs aren't the most comfortable ever, but I've used a chair from this company for at least a year now without issue and it gets the job done. That's why I bought this one - I needed one for my home office and don't want to spend a fortune on a chair.I'm fat and these chairs have held together more than any other chair I've had previously.
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United States on 6 March 2022

name: Big and Tall Office Chair Ergonomic Chair 400lbs Wide Seat Executive Desk Chair with Lumbar Support Adjustable Armrest Headrest High Back Mesh Computer Chair Rolling Swivel Task Chair(Black)
reviews: This was easy to assemble and although I am apprehensive about breaking the chair it is holding up very well.  Two negative points.  The first and biggest issue is the actual seat is VERY hard.  I have two different types of seat cushions to make it tolerable.  The other issue the headrest.  It is only really usable when you are leaning all the way back and reclining.  There is no way to adjust the headrest it to use for support while sitting up.  I will add that there is a good lower lumbar support in the chair back.
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United States on 9 April 2021

name: Big and Tall Office Chair Ergonomic Chair 400lbs Wide Seat Executive Desk Chair with Lumbar Support Adjustable Armrest Headrest High Back Mesh Computer Chair Rolling Swivel Task Chair(Black)
reviews: This is a great chair for the price. I was grateful I could leave off the top headrest.The width is great, but the seat cushion could be a little more durable. I suspect it will wear out and go flat soon, but I don't know that for a fact. A lumbar cushion will solve that issue.
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United States on 7 August 2022

name: Big and Tall Office Chair Ergonomic Chair 400lbs Wide Seat Executive Desk Chair with Lumbar Support Adjustable Armrest Headrest High Back Mesh Computer Chair Rolling Swivel Task Chair(Black)
reviews: Feels goodNot the best butIt is better then paying more
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United States on 10 August 2023

name: Big and Tall Office Chair Ergonomic Chair 400lbs Wide Seat Executive Desk Chair with Lumbar Support Adjustable Armrest Headrest High Back Mesh Computer Chair Rolling Swivel Task Chair(Black)
reviews: When I first got this chair it was easy to put together, but there was a broken cosmetic part that only affected the look of the chair from behind in a minor way. The comfort of it initially was actually quite good, but a month later the cushion was flat and I had to find myself an additional seat cushion.Otherwise, this chair has been fairly solid, though it seems the padding of the arms isn't properly screwed on as the screw fell out of it and I had to put it back in and it wouldn't really tighten down. It was as if the screw was screwed into the soft underside of the rubber arm padding itself rather than a pilot hole that is properly anchored into the padding.Over all, this chair was a very average to below average experience, which is upsetting as I was hoping to find something comfortable but I suppose you pay for what you get. This chair will do in a pinch but you very much need an additional seat cushion and hope that the parts you do receive are complete and undamaged.
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United States on 28 October 2021

name: Big and Tall Office Chair Ergonomic Chair 400lbs Wide Seat Executive Desk Chair with Lumbar Support Adjustable Armrest Headrest High Back Mesh Computer Chair Rolling Swivel Task Chair(Black)
reviews: Got this cause I be a big big.  280 lbs.  Seems to work well, the headrest is made cheap, mounted even cheaper.  I have a small pillow from another desk chair that I have added to do the headrest job better.
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United States on 5 April 2023

name: Big and Tall Office Chair Ergonomic Chair 400lbs Wide Seat Executive Desk Chair with Lumbar Support Adjustable Armrest Headrest High Back Mesh Computer Chair Rolling Swivel Task Chair(Black)
reviews: (See end of review for update)Bought this over some cheaper gamer-style chairs because it looked more solidly built - areas that would be plastic on other chairs are rolled steel tubing such as the bottom arms where the wheels attach, the struts that hold the arms on, the connection between back and seat, etc. Brass insets for where the screws attach to the interior of the seat cushion so they won't rip out over time. Instructions are good and easy to follow, just look closely at the pictures (very few words, but diagrams are clear). Comes with an assembly tool and a few extra screws in case you misplace any (though just one extra of each). Chair seems well-built relative to other things in this price range, though still manufactured in China. Some adjustment on the width of the arms when assembling (or after if you flip it over and adjust the screws, ~1in. of travel in either direction). Seated position is a little forward with rock back tension that can be adjusted, but no lock back (only lock horizontal). Would say this is designed more as a productivity chair than say a gaming chair - can't lock back in reclined position, but this is more what I wanted anyway. Typical gas piston height adjustment. Seat cushion is both thick and comfortable. Back is high and well suited to taller people (why I bought this chair).Edit: Seemed good at first but broke within six months. Can't even figure out what's causing it to lean to one side now, all screws retightened but it still has an odd leftwards list to it.
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United States on 14 March 2021

name: Big and Tall Office Chair Ergonomic Chair 400lbs Wide Seat Executive Desk Chair with Lumbar Support Adjustable Armrest Headrest High Back Mesh Computer Chair Rolling Swivel Task Chair(Black)
reviews: Chair is rated to 400 lbs.  I weigh 280.  I have worked from home ever since I bought the chair so I spend 8-10 hours per weekday sitting in this chair.  The cushion in the seat was comfortable for the first ~6 months.  After that, I had to have a pad on top of the seat in order to sit comfortably.  Unfortunately, the pad raised the seat height too much and, over time, I ended up with ergonomic issues in my neck.  I cannot recommend this chair as my experience with its durability has been poor.  Besides the seat, the rest of the chair is still in good functional shape but what good is a chair that you can't sit on?
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United States on 2 July 2022

name: Big and Tall Office Chair Ergonomic Chair 400lbs Wide Seat Executive Desk Chair with Lumbar Support Adjustable Armrest Headrest High Back Mesh Computer Chair Rolling Swivel Task Chair(Black)
reviews: Chair is wobbly after 6 months. I'm under 250 lbs.  The chair is rated for 400 lbs.  The gas piston seems ok but the mechanism is damaged. I spent $150 originally and the spare parts is $90.00.Chair is crap.
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United States on 25 November 2023

name: Big and Tall Office Chair Ergonomic Chair 400lbs Wide Seat Executive Desk Chair with Lumbar Support Adjustable Armrest Headrest High Back Mesh Computer Chair Rolling Swivel Task Chair(Black)
reviews: This chair needs much thicker padding on the seat. There's about an inch and a half worth of foam between you and a hard metal base, and after awhile, you feel like you're sitting on the bleachers at a sporting event. I always end up sitting on a bed pillow for comfort. I'm actually on Amazon today to shop for a chair cushion.
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United States on 11 April 2023

name: Big and Tall Office Chair Ergonomic Chair 400lbs Wide Seat Executive Desk Chair with Lumbar Support Adjustable Armrest Headrest High Back Mesh Computer Chair Rolling Swivel Task Chair(Black)

Customer support took care of me really quickly.These chairs aren't the most comfortable ever, but I've used a chair from this company for at least a year now without issue and it gets the job done. reviews: 6 months in, and it is bending already. When I sit in it, the chair is now leaning HEAVILY to the right. Way off center. I am 300lbs, well below the rated weight.
date.of.review: Reviewed in Japan on 16 August 2022

name: Big and Tall Office Chair Ergonomic Chair 400lbs Wide Seat Executive Desk Chair with Lumbar Support Adjustable Armrest Headrest High Back Mesh Computer Chair Rolling Swivel Task Chair(Black)
reviews: Had a few months and the chair has a lean to it now, Starting to hurt my back, Terrible product. I am only 300 lbs and It didn't last at all.Impossible to contact seller.AVOID at all costs. Huge waste of money.
date.of.review: Reviewed in Canada on 6 December 2021

name: Big and Tall Office Chair Ergonomic Chair 400lbs Wide Seat Executive Desk Chair with Lumbar Support Adjustable Armrest Headrest High Back Mesh Computer Chair Rolling Swivel Task Chair(Black)
reviews: The chair is very well made and was easy to put together.  It is large enough to hold a larger person.  It is also comfortable to sit in for a longer period of time.  The arm height adjusts for comfort, too.
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United States on 13 June 2021

name: Big and Tall Office Chair Ergonomic Chair 400lbs Wide Seat Executive Desk Chair with Lumbar Support Adjustable Armrest Headrest High Back Mesh Computer Chair Rolling Swivel Task Chair(Black)
reviews: Less than 1 year old, parts keep loosening, falling off and the base broke where the piston goes in and is not repairable... I would look elsewhere if you are a larger person.Would not recommend.
date.of.review: Reviewed in Canada on 12 February 2022

name: Big and Tall Office Chair Ergonomic Chair 400lbs Wide Seat Executive Desk Chair with Lumbar Support Adjustable Armrest Headrest High Back Mesh Computer Chair Rolling Swivel Task Chair(Black)
reviews: I bought this because my computer desk is a little higher than normal. in a regular office chair my elbows are lower than my wrists causing the area just above my wrist to dig into the edge of the table. 30 minutes of that and hands fall asleep.went together fast and fairly easy. seat is a little hard, but then it is made for someone heavy (I'm 6 foot 177 pounds). but I bet it just needs breaking in a little. the arms are a tad uncomfortable as they are concaved and if your arm is not lined up with depression they gently dig into your forarm (still better than the hard edge of my desk). other than that, can't beat it for the money.
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United States on 26 March 2021

name: Big and Tall Office Chair Ergonomic Chair 400lbs Wide Seat Executive Desk Chair with Lumbar Support Adjustable Armrest Headrest High Back Mesh Computer Chair Rolling Swivel Task Chair(Black)
reviews: I'm not usually one to write negative reviews, but I'm definitely a bit disappointed in this chair. For the first few months it was fantastic - the cushion is comfortable, and the mesh back is great if you're the type that gets hot sitting in a leather or faux leather seat for chunks of time.I purchased the chair in July of 2022. It's March of 2023 and I'm already looking for a replacement after just 7ish months of use. I'm certainly below the rated weight limit, and despite that, I started encountering slow-but-consistent issues gradually popping up.The first thing to go was the screw that holds the left armrest in place (pictured). It somehow went straight through the foam-like material and ruined that armrest when I leaned against it. I got an annoying cut from it, but with some repositioning, I was able to get it into a decent enough position to be workable ...until the right armrest screw straight up fell out about a month later.After both armrests had their issues, the mechanism that stops you from leaning back all the way started acting up. As opposed to leaning straight back, it now leans back and to the side in a way that makes you feel like it will topple at any moment.Finally, and the straw that broke the camel's back this week, was the lift function stopping. You can lift the chair as high as it will go, and then very slowly sink back down to its lowest point while you're sitting. I'm glad to have an adjustable desk that I can lower to fit the chair's lowest point while I shop for a new one, but my desk is now at knee height, which isn't super fun.Considering the price, I shouldn't have had super high expectations - you get what you pay for. At the same time, it would have been nice to last at least a year? Instead I got a little over half a year of experiencing a new problem popping out of the blue to surprise me each month.
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United States on 2 March 2023

name: Big and Tall Office Chair Ergonomic Chair 400lbs Wide Seat Executive Desk Chair with Lumbar Support Adjustable Armrest Headrest High Back Mesh Computer Chair Rolling Swivel Task Chair(Black)
reviews: For a chair that is meant for 400lbs this chair slowly loses height.  We have only had it for 2.5 months.  I will file a claim.
date.of.review: Reviewed in Canada on 16 September 2022

name: Big and Tall Office Chair Ergonomic Chair 400lbs Wide Seat Executive Desk Chair with Lumbar Support Adjustable Armrest Headrest High Back Mesh Computer Chair Rolling Swivel Task Chair(Black)
reviews: I picked this chair for a full time home office set up. The assembly was typical for a chair of this type. For two years, it was mostly comfortable and did the job of me not thinking about what was supporting my large body while I was doing my job.The last month or so, I was starting to feel more aches after sitting in it. This last week, it was wobbly and very unstable to sit in. As I was switching the chair out with its replacement, my cat jumped on it and that was the final stress that broke the chair that I had for 2.5 years. The photo is the underside of the chair with the metal plate that failed to attach to the hydrolic shaft.
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United States on 24 November 2023

name: Big and Tall Office Chair Ergonomic Chair 400lbs Wide Seat Executive Desk Chair with Lumbar Support Adjustable Armrest Headrest High Back Mesh Computer Chair Rolling Swivel Task Chair(Black)
reviews: I‚Äôm 6 ft 440 with pretty wide hips and thighs and I fit this chair perfectly. It makes me feel like something was actually made for me. It‚Äôs crazy that skinny people get to feel like that all the time. Just comfortable in every setting. Anywho. It‚Äôs roomy and the arm rests adjust up and down so they don‚Äôt dig into your thighs at all. I have mine as high as they go. 4 stars cause the seat could use a way thicker/more plush cushion. It‚Äôs pretty dense.
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United States on 15 March 2023

name: Big and Tall Office Chair Ergonomic Chair 400lbs Wide Seat Executive Desk Chair with Lumbar Support Adjustable Armrest Headrest High Back Mesh Computer Chair Rolling Swivel Task Chair(Black)
reviews: The only thing that bothers me is that when I went to tighten one of the pieces under the cushion, it made a cracking sound and now I head that all the time. I wasn't sure if I was supposed to just make it a snug fit while tightening though.Still extremely comfortable. I like the arch support for my lower back to help me sit up straight.
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United States on 7 April 2023

date.of.review: Reviewed in the United States on 10 August 2023

name: Big and Tall Office Chair Ergonomic Chair 400lbs Wide Seat Executive Desk Chair with Lumbar Support Adjustable Armrest Headrest High Back Mesh Computer Chair Rolling Swivel Task Chair(Black)
reviews: When I first got this chair it was easy to put together, but there was a broken cosmetic part that only affected the look of the chair from behind in a minor way. The comfort of it initially was actually quite good, but a month later the cushion was flat and I had to find myself an additional seat cushion.Otherwise, this chair has been fairly solid, though it seems the padding of the arms isn't properly screwed on as the screw fell out of it and I had to put it back in and it wouldn't really tighten down. It was as if the screw was screwed into the soft underside of the rubber arm padding itself rather than a pilot hole that is properly anchored into the padding.Over all, this chair was a very average to below average experience, which is upsetting as I was hoping to find something comfortable but I suppose you pay for what you get. This chair will do in a pinch but you very much need an additional seat cushion and hope that the parts you do receive are complete and undamaged.
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United States on 28 October 2021

name: Big and Tall Office Chair Ergonomic Chair 400lbs Wide Seat Executive Desk Chair with Lumbar Support Adjustable Armrest Headrest High Back Mesh Computer Chair Rolling Swivel Task Chair(Black)
reviews: Got this cause I be a big big.  280 lbs.  Seems to work well, the headrest is made cheap, mounted even cheaper.  I have a small pillow from another desk chair that I have added to do the headrest job better.
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United States on 5 April 2023

name: Big and Tall Office Chair Ergonomic Chair 400lbs Wide Seat Executive Desk Chair with Lumbar Support Adjustable Armrest Headrest High Back Mesh Computer Chair Rolling Swivel Task Chair(Black)
reviews: (See end of review for update)Bought this over some cheaper gamer-style chairs because it looked more solidly built - areas that would be plastic on other chairs are rolled steel tubing such as the bottom arms where the wheels attach, the struts that hold the arms on, the connection between back and seat, etc. Brass insets for where the screws attach to the interior of the seat cushion so they won't rip out over time. Instructions are good and easy to follow, just look closely at the pictures (very few words, but diagrams are clear). Comes with an assembly tool and a few extra screws in case you misplace any (though just one extra of each). Chair seems well-built relative to other things in this price range, though still manufactured in China. Some adjustment on the width of the arms when assembling (or after if you flip it over and adjust the screws, ~1in. of travel in either direction). Seated position is a little forward with rock back tension that can be adjusted, but no lock back (only lock horizontal). Would say this is designed more as a productivity chair than say a gaming chair - can't lock back in reclined position, but this is more what I wanted anyway. Typical gas piston height adjustment. Seat cushion is both thick and comfortable. Back is high and well suited to taller people (why I bought this chair).Edit: Seemed good at first but broke within six months. Can't even figure out what's causing it to lean to one side now, all screws retightened but it still has an odd leftwards list to it.
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United States on 14 March 2021

name: Big and Tall Office Chair Ergonomic Chair 400lbs Wide Seat Executive Desk Chair with Lumbar Support Adjustable Armrest Headrest High Back Mesh Computer Chair Rolling Swivel Task Chair(Black)
reviews: Chair is rated to 400 lbs.  I weigh 280.  I have worked from home ever since I bought the chair so I spend 8-10 hours per weekday sitting in this chair.  The cushion in the seat was comfortable for the first ~6 months.  After that, I had to have a pad on top of the seat in order to sit comfortably.  Unfortunately, the pad raised the seat height too much and, over time, I ended up with ergonomic issues in my neck.  I cannot recommend this chair as my experience with its durability has been poor.  Besides the seat, the rest of the chair is still in good functional shape but what good is a chair that you can't sit on?
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United States on 2 July 2022

name: Big and Tall Office Chair Ergonomic Chair 400lbs Wide Seat Executive Desk Chair with Lumbar Support Adjustable Armrest Headrest High Back Mesh Computer Chair Rolling Swivel Task Chair(Black)
reviews: Chair is wobbly after 6 months. I'm under 250 lbs.  The chair is rated for 400 lbs.  The gas piston seems ok but the mechanism is damaged. I spent $150 originally and the spare parts is $90.00.Chair is crap.
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United States on 25 November 2023

name: Big and Tall Office Chair Ergonomic Chair 400lbs Wide Seat Executive Desk Chair with Lumbar Support Adjustable Armrest Headrest High Back Mesh Computer Chair Rolling Swivel Task Chair(Black)
reviews: This chair needs much thicker padding on the seat. There's about an inch and a half worth of foam between you and a hard metal base, and after awhile, you feel like you're sitting on the bleachers at a sporting event. I always end up sitting on a bed pillow for comfort. I'm actually on Amazon today to shop for a chair cushion.
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United States on 11 April 2023

name: Big and Tall Office Chair Ergonomic Chair 400lbs Wide Seat Executive Desk Chair with Lumbar Support Adjustable Armrest Headrest High Back Mesh Computer Chair Rolling Swivel Task Chair(Black)
reviews: Got the chair and part of the back plastic was broken (not anything structural). Customer support took care of me really quickly.These chairs aren't the most comfortable ever, but I've used a chair from this company for at least a year now without issue and it gets the job done. That's why I bought this one - I needed one for my home office and don't want to spend a fortune on a chair.I'm fat and these chairs have held together more than any other chair I've had previously.
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United States on 6 March 2022

name: Big and Tall Office Chair Ergonomic Chair 400lbs Wide Seat Executive Desk Chair with Lumbar Support Adjustable Armrest Headrest High Back Mesh Computer Chair Rolling Swivel Task Chair(Black)
reviews: This was easy to assemble and although I am apprehensive about breaking the chair it is holding up very well.  Two negative points.  The first and biggest issue is the actual seat is VERY hard.  I have two different types of seat cushions to make it tolerable.  The other issue the headrest.  It is only really usable when you are leaning all the way back and reclining.  There is no way to adjust the headrest it to use for support while sitting up.  I will add that there is a good lower lumbar support in the chair back.
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United States on 9 April 2021

name: Big and Tall Office Chair Ergonomic Chair 400lbs Wide Seat Executive Desk Chair with Lumbar Support Adjustable Armrest Headrest High Back Mesh Computer Chair Rolling Swivel Task Chair(Black)
reviews: This is a great chair for the price. I was grateful I could leave off the top headrest.The width is great, but the seat cushion could be a little more durable. I suspect it will wear out and go flat soon, but I don't know that for a fact. A lumbar cushion will solve that issue.
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United States on 7 August 2022

name: Flash Furniture Whitney High Back Desk Chair - Black LeatherSoft Executive Swivel Office Chair with Black Frame - Swivel Arm Chair
reviews: This chair was delivered to me 5 weeks ago. Packaged well, delivered on time.  It was very easily put together and is a really nice looking item .  However,  it has serious issues and I deeply regret this purchase. Its seat padding has sunk very quickly and imm constantly sliding off it as a result, the seat consistently drops to its lowest height setting  Somehow the back lumber support arch is too high, its very uncomfortable indeed.  (I am 5'8")For a budget desk chair you can't fault its appearance but it simply does not deliver in terms of comfort and seating position.
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 2 June 2023

I‚Äôve emailed the manufacturer directly and have not heard back.I spent a little more on a chair for the aesthetic and of course it is damaged. Annoyed with the lack of customer service.Edit: I was contacted and sent a new arm replacement. I get so many compliments on this chair.
date.of.review: Reviewed in Canada on 25 April 2023

name: Flash Furniture Whitney High Back Desk Chair - Black LeatherSoft Executive Swivel Office Chair with Black Frame - Swivel Arm Chair
reviews: I ordered this office chair as I needed a new one and decided to go with the white/gold to match my desk. Although the gold on the chair and my desk are two different finishes of gold, it has a bit of a chic-like look and feel to it.I know many of the reviews say this chair is very easy to assemble but it‚Äôs more like semi-easy-ish. While understanding the parts and having the knowledge of assembling the chair, it‚Äôs not as easy to assemble if you‚Äôre doing it by yourself. Many of the screw placement holes don‚Äôt fully align correctly so you have to use force to manually align your parts to each hole in order to successfully drill all of your screws in tightly. Assembly time is much slower when using a manual Allen wrench so I suggest using a powered one instead as it‚Äôs more efficient.It‚Äôs a comfortable chair and I personally like the straight back support it gives me. I have read reviews that the chair will decline in quality after heavy use but unless you are jumping on this thing, I don‚Äôt think the wear and tear will happen. I can‚Äôt say the same for the faux leather element because we just never know.Overall, it‚Äôs not a bad chair for the price. I would recommend it for yourself.
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United States on 29 August 2023

name: Flash Furniture Whitney High Back Desk Chair - Black LeatherSoft Executive Swivel Office Chair with Black Frame - Swivel Arm Chair
reviews: I purchased this chair to replace one my husband had bought when he was in college. I got a new job that allows me to work from home and was looking for a new chair that I could comfortably sit in all day and not suffer with back pain. We're two weeks in and it's already noticeable better than our previous. I can adjust it to lean back if I need to. I would definitely recommend it as of right now.I love the white and gold. It definitely fits with the color scheme I had planned.

name: Flash Furniture Whitney High Back Desk Chair - Black LeatherSoft Executive Swivel Office Chair with Black Frame - Swivel Arm Chair
reviews: I recently purchased this rolling desk chair on Amazon, and I love it. Here's a brief rundown:Easy Assembly:My teenager put it together in no time ‚Äì the instructions were clear, and all tools were included.Surprisingly Sturdy:For the price, it's impressively solid. No wobbling; it feels well-built and dependable.Comfortable Design:Perfect for long hours at the desk. Great back support and just the right cushioning.Great Value:Considering the quality and speed of delivery, it's a steal. A fantastic buy for the price.In short, if you need an affordable, easy-to-assemble, sturdy, and comfy rolling desk chair, this is it! Highly recommend.

name: Flash Furniture Mid-Back Transparent Black Mesh Executive Swivel Office Chair with Melrose Gold Frame and Flip-Up Arms, BL-8801X-GG
reviews: Bought for working from home. I liked that it had flip-up arms and seemed to have good amount of adjustments.Immediately after trying the chair I found its lumbar support was much too extreme, and could not be adjusted.  Above the lumbar support the back of the chair slopes off too sharply for your back to really rest on, so when sitting at the computer the only part of your back that touched the chair was your very lower back.  This quickly became too uncomfortable to use for a long period.  Also first impressions some of the materials felt cheap, and some of the paint was scratched and flaked off the chair before even taking it out of the box.  Between these issues I ended up returning the chair.As a positive the mesh seems good, the seat itself feels OK and decently supportive.  The recline for the seat back was nice and you could lock in place.
date.of.review: Reviewed in Canada on 9 October 2020

name: Flash Furniture Mid-Back Transparent Black Mesh Executive Swivel Office Chair with Melrose Gold Frame and Flip-Up Arms, BL-8801X-GG

name: Flash Furniture Mid-Back Transparent Black Mesh Executive Swivel Office Chair with Melrose Gold Frame and Flip-Up Arms, BL-8801X-GG
reviews: Love the chair arrived on date stated. It looks like the paint had worn off on right side of seat but all in all it looks fantastic. It was  very easy to put together as I had an injury on one hand and had no issues. I thought the back rest looked a bit pronounced but fit my back like a glove. I bought this for my work station at work as they had raised it up to35‚Äù to he top chair will extend higher than I have it , around 33‚Äù but at 260lb it sank about 2‚Äù so a very comfortable height  the foot ring I did not raise as it was a good height for me. The controls for height and tilt are with in reach and operates  smoothly ,only issue I have I wish the are rests would LD ratchet to different levels but no biggey. I also purchased the roller blade wheels for the chair this only made a great chair awesome I need to get a hook or something to pull myself back to the desk as it rolls so smooth and quite this is my best purchase of the year I would highly recommend this chair no regrets here.
